**Why join?** 
 This is a chance to join a tight-knit, ambitious team where your contributions will directly shape the company’s future. If this sounds exciting and a good match to your skills feel free to apply.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Join a leading Financial Services Innovator - Two key tech roles available!!
 



  





 We’re partnering with a forward-thinking organisation in the financial services sector that is on an exciting journey to transform its technology landscape. This company is committed to innovation, leveraging data and AI to create smarter, faster, and more efficient solutions for its customers. With a strong focus on modern cloud technologies and cutting-edge AI, they offer an environment where ideas quickly become reality.
 



  





 Open Positions
 



  





 1. BI Developer / Data Engineer
 



*(MS Azure stack, Power BI)* 




 This is a full-stack role where you’ll work across front-end reporting and data engineering. Whether you lean more towards BI or data engineering, flexibility is key - the team values diverse strengths.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 


* Design and optimise data pipelines in Azure
* Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports
* Collaborate with stakeholders to deliver actionable insights
* Work with Azure Data Factory, Synapse, SQL, and potentially Databricks
* Ensure data quality and governance across the platform



  





 Ideal Profile:
 


* Strong experience with MS Azure and Power BI
* Solid SQL skills and understanding of data modelling
* Ability to work across both reporting and engineering tasks
* A proactive mindset and passion for building solutions that drive business decisions



  





 2. AI Engineer
 



*(GenAI, LLMs, Azure)* 




 This role is at the intersection of data engineering and AI innovation. You’ll help build the foundation for AI-driven solutions, from model training to integration with business processes.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 


* Design and optimise data pipelines for AI usage
* Build and integrate LLM and AI-agent solutions into internal systems
* Set up and manage infrastructure for model training and inference
* Work with APIs, data flows, and prompt engineering
* Contribute to an AI platform that combines data, modelling, and product development



  





 Tech Stack & Tools:
 


* Azure Data Factory, Synapse, SQL, Databricks
* Python, Pandas, PySpark
* LLM integrations via OpenAI API, Azure OpenAI
* CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps
* Opportunity to experiment with vector databases, RAG flows, and agent frameworks



  





 Ideal Profile:
 


* Degree in computer science, AI, or equivalent experience
* 2+ years in data engineering, machine learning, or AI development
* Skilled in Python and SQL
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure preferred)
* Interest or experience in AI/LLM integrations and prompt engineering
* Bonus: Experience with Azure ML, LangChain, or Semantic Kernel



  





 Ready to make your next move?
 



 This organisation is moving fast and has the capacity to make decisions before Christmas - perfect for those looking to secure their next position and start the new year strong.
 



  





 Reach out to me directly for full details or to apply. Interviews are happening soon, so don’t miss out!
 



  





 Please note, full professional Swedish fluency is required for the role.

title: Senior Frontend Developer (React)
description:
Tacton is looking for a
 **Senior Frontend Developer (React)** 
 to join our R&D department.
   

  

 We're on an exciting journey and have just launched the first version of our analytics platform, and in this role, you’ll play a key part in developing and maintaining state-of-the-art frontend applications that enable data exploration, dashboard visualization, and automation. If clean architecture, modern tech stacks, and creating real impact through data excite you, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develop new features for our analytics tools using modern frontend technologies
* Maintain performance and stability by fixing bugs and optimizing code
* Refactor legacy components and enhance existing systems Continuously improve our architecture, testing frameworks, and developer tools
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Product Managers, Architects, and Developers


**Our Tech Stack Includes**
* Frontend: React (functional components), TypeScript (TSX), Redux Toolkit
* Build tools: Webpack 5 (with migration to Vite on the roadmap)
* CI/CD: GitHub, Buildkite, Docker
* Testing: Cypress (end-to-end), Jest (unit), Percy (visual regression)


**Requirements**
* 6+ years of experience in frontend development
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and React
* Experience working on large-scale frontend applications
* Deep understanding of modern web development paradigms (e.g., functional programming, predictable state management, component-based architecture
* A track record of writing testable, readable, and maintainable code
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
* Proactive mindset with a focus on continuous improvement
* Ability to work independently and comfortable working on-site 3 days per week


**Who You Are**
* Passionate about creating clean, efficient, and user-focused interfaces
* Detail-oriented with a strong understanding of performance and optimization
* A collaborative team player who values a feedback-friendly environment
* Eager to take initiative and ownership of technical challenges
* Curious and always looking to learn new tools and techniques


**Preferred But Not Required**
* Experience with Redux Toolkit (RTK), Vite, Docker, React Hooks, and Sentry
* Basic knowledge of Python to collaborate on backend API adjustments
* Strong sense for modern UI/UX design principles


**What We Offer**
* A solid and trusted company with over two decades of experience, global customers — and an exciting journey of continued growth!
* A collaborative engineering culture – work with a senior team that helps you grow, shares knowledge, and challenges you to do your best work.
* 33 days of paid time off – 30 vacation days plus 3 extra to make sure you get the rest you deserve
* Generous wellness allowance – to support your health and wellbeing.
* Private healthcare insurance – Skip the waiting lines and get quick access to private medical care, including specialist consultations and treatments.


**We’re Excited To Hear From You**
 If you have any questions or just want to know more about the role — don’t hesitate to reach out. We’d love for you to apply as soon as possible,
 **apply no later than 6:th of January.**
**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Code test & technical interview
* Final interview with our CTO
* Reference checks


**About Tacton**
*Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help manufacturers overcome their most critical product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we’ve grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.*
 Learn more at
 **tacton.com/about**
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: BI Developer in Solution Team
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your role
   

  

 Join our Solution Team as a BI Developer and turn complex business questions into clear, actionable insights. You will collaborate with stakeholders across functions, design robust data models, and deliver trusted dashboards and reports that drive decisions. This role suits a results-focused professional who bridges business needs with modern data practices in a secure, mission-driven domain.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Partner with business stakeholders to translate objectives into data and reporting solutions
* Design, implement, and maintain scalable data models in our data warehouse
* Build, operate, and optimize ETL/ELT pipelines to ensure reliable, timely data
* Develop intuitive dashboards and self-service reports that surface the right KPIs
* Write performant SQL and conduct deep-dive analyses to answer ad‑hoc questions
* Ensure data quality, lineage, documentation, and governance across the BI stack
* Manage and tune databases; contribute to standards for schema, indexing, and performance
* Automate recurring data tasks using scripting languages
* Collaborate closely with engineering and domain experts to deliver end-to-end BI solutions
* Share best practices and mentor colleagues on data visualization and storytelling


 Your profile
   

  

 We’re seeking a motivated and committed individual, who are outcome-oriented with a strong business mindset and a senior communication style. Someone who thrives in a hybrid, multi-site collaboration environment within a defence context.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

* 3–5 years of experience as a BI Developer/Analytics Engineer or similar
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or equivalent experience
* Strong SQL skills and solid grasp of data modeling and warehousing concepts
* Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT processes and data pipeline tooling
* Proficiency in data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Qlik Sense, PowerBI )
* Experience with database management and performance optimization
* Comfortable with scripting languages (e.g., Python, R, or similar) for automation


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Why join us? At our company, you will own high-impact solutions that support service members, partners, and critical national infrastructure, making a real difference through your work. You will lead meaningful projects within a modern Digital Solutions organisation that enjoys strong executive sponsorship, providing ample opportunities for growth. We offer a flexible hybrid work model to ensure a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
   

  

 How to apply: Submit your CV along with a brief note highlighting a case you worked on, including the business problem you addressed and the outcomes achieved.
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*

title: Workflow Developer in Process Automation Team | SEB, Solna
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Workflow Developer that has a genuine interest in process automation practices and tools. You will be a part of FCP Process Automation team and the role offers a rare chance to shape the future of financial crime prevention through technology. As a core contributor, you'll craft an entirely new way of working for our FCP Investigators, empowering them with intuitive, efficient workflow tools to uncover and act on suspicious activity faster than ever before. Your work will make investigative tools more efficient and impactful, enabling investigators to protect society from financial crime. You'll also be at the forefront of innovation, as the FCP Process Automation team has developed an innovative GenAI assistant that redefines how intelligence is captured and transformed. If you're passionate about future-proof technology, process efficiency, and making a real-world difference, this is the role to apply for.
   

  

 As Workflow developer you will be cooperating with specialists from the team (Java Developer, Data Engineers, and QA) to create automated processes. The team is distributed between Solna and Warsaw.
   

  

**As a Workflow Developer, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Designing and implementing Workflow solutions, ensuring it follows solution development best-practices.
* Providing work estimates and timely updates on solution development progress.
* Collaboration with other developers from the team and IT architects on defining the process implementation design.
* Helping business to understand technical capabilities, suggesting the best possible solutions and explaining limitations.
* Implementing integrations within process solution and external systems.
* Defining way of working practices, suggesting and implementing improvements.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
* Experience in Process Automation.
* Experience in IBM BAW or ICM or BPM products (or similar like Camunda or jBPM), would be considered as a strong advantage.
* Experience in business process discovery, modeling and analysis (BPMA, BPMN) tools
* Good knowledge of JavaScript, Webservices (SOAP, REST).
* Core GCP service knowledge
* Analytical thinking
* Ability to learn and adapt to changes quickly.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken


**What We Offer**
* We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-life balance.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB and our team. Since we meet candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **2026-01-31** 
 .
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Process Developer in Lending | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about driving change and improving processes? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment where your technical expertise can create real business value? If so, SEB has an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 Since our founding in 1856, SEB has been a leader in building strong customer relationships and driving sustainable growth. As one of Northern Europe’s top financial service groups, we empower our employees to grow, take responsibility, and make an impact. Welcome to SEB!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As part of the SEB Group, we at Business Services provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Our dedicated team of over 1,700 employees is focused on driving business development and growth. If you want to step up and be part of an engaging environment where you can turn your everyday actions into global results, this is where you get to shine, at the heart of the action.
   

  

 As a Process Developer, you’ll play a key role in designing, optimizing and automating end-to-end processes within the Leasing area. You’ll ensure alignment with SEB’s product and process strategies, work closely with Business Services, and leverage technical solutions, including AI, to enhance process performance, decision-making, and mitigate risks. You’ll also collaborate closely with Business, Tech, and stakeholders in the Financing Tribe to drive meaningful improvements.
   

  

**In Addition, The Role Will Also Include**
* Lead and support key change initiatives.
* Analyze, design and implement new requirements.
* Collaborate with product specialists and cross-functional teams.
* Drive process efficiency and improve workflows.
* Build and maintain end-to-end process knowledge.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* The qualities of a proactive problem solver who excels in change management and process optimization. You use data to make informed decisions and thrive in cross-functional collaboration.
* Experience in non-financial risk management.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* An analytical mindset with a solution-oriented approach.
* Familiarity with both business and technical aspects.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
* Preferable expertise in process mapping and efficiency improvements.
* Preferable proven ability to analyze data for informed decision making.
* Preferable experience in leading initiatives of varying scale.
* Preferable knowledge of technical solutions in process optimization.
* Experience or knowledge in Leasing is a plus but not required


 What we offer
   

  

* Access to extensive training and development programmes.
* A healthy work-life balance in an inclusive, welcoming culture.
* Competitive compensation and access to SEB’s staff banking benefits, including health insurance and pension savings.
* International career opportunities and exposure to a global working environment.
* A meaningful role with opportunities to drive impactful change.


 Do you want to be a part of SEB?
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than Feb 1, 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Birsena Saljunovic, birsena.saljunovic@seb.se , but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts:
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Senior Fullstack Developer (Java/Javascript)
description:
**Välkommen till B3 Innovation – där teknik och trivsel går hand i hand!**
 Välkommen till B3 Innovation, hjärtat av systemutveckling inom B3 Consulting Group! Här kombinerar vi den familjära känslan från ett småföretag med storbolagets resurser.
   

  

 Vi är ett engagerat gäng med konsulter som specialiserar oss på systemutveckling inom Java och moderna JavaScriptramverk. I en miljö där du får möjlighet att växa både professionellt och personligt i en inkluderande gemenskap. Oavsett om du är en passionerad cyklist eller en bokslukare, så finns det plats för dig hos oss.
   

  

**Om rollen som fullstackutvecklare inom Java/** 
 Javascript på B3 Innovation
   

  

 Som Senior fullstackutvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* utveckla högkvalitativa och skalbara lösningar
* samarbeta med ett tvärfunktionellt team av experter
* Delta i design och arkitektur av nya system.


**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet och arbetat i fullstackrollen under en längre tid. Du som har hunnit både göra misstag och även lära av dem. Förhoppningsvis tycker du om att arbeta i team, dela med dig av dina kunskaper och vill fortsätta att lära dig nytt.
   

  

 Våra krav för att du ska passa i denna roll:
   

  

* Du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av utvecklarrollen.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med Java, Javascript, Kotlin, Spring, Microservices.
* Du har god kunskap att jobba med olika ramverk som React, Angular och Vue.
* Du har erfarenhet av att jobba i agila team.


**Varför B3 Innovation?**
* Innovativ Kultur: Vi uppmuntrar kreativitet och nya idéer.
* Inkluderande miljö: Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter en arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna.
* Balans och flexibilitet: Flexibilitet är centralt, vilket gör att du kan forma din arbetsdag för att få livspusslet att gå ihop. Vi förstår vikten av balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder därför flexibla arbetstider.
* Gemenskap: Hos oss blir du en del av ett stöttande team som arbetar tillsammans för att nå gemensamma mål. Det handlar inte bara om “jobb jobb jobb” hos oss. Vi anordnar allt från tech-workshops till sociala aktiviteter som stickcaféer, spelkvällar och AW.


**Om B3 Innovation**
 Vi är kända för vårt fokus på innovation och förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Genom att kombinera djup teknisk expertis med en stark förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet, skapar vi lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Vår kultur bygger på öppenhet, samarbete och en passion för teknik.
   

  

 Vi prioriterar personlig utveckling och erbjuder verktyg som B3 Academy, TechTalks och "Lunch & Learn" för att du ska kunna växa.
   

  

 Upptäck möjligheterna med B3 Innovation. Som utvecklare får du arbeta inom spännande branscher som media, bank och finans, energi, offentlig sektor, telekom och e-handel. Oavsett om du optimerar TV-sändningar, utvecklar digitala banktjänster eller skapar smarta hem, hjälper vi dig att hitta det perfekta uppdraget som matchar dina intressen.
   

  

 Våra toppbetyg i medarbetarundersökningar visar att nöjda kollegor är kärnan i vår framgång. Är du redo att kliva in i en miljö där utveckling och trivsel går hand i hand?
   

  

 Som sagt, välkommen till B3 Innovation – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?**
 Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade och innovativa team!
   

  

 Om du är mer nyfiken på oss så kan du läsa mer om oss här: https://www.b3.se/innovation
   

  

 Om du har funderingar så hör gärna av dig till Kenneth Andersson på +46706678050 alt mail kenneth.andersson@b3.se.

title: Design Engineer (Web & Brand)
description:
TL;DR - We’re seeking an exceptional Design Engineer to help us communicate the future of AI. You’ll work closely with design and marketing to build world-class web content helping empower the next generation of creators and builders.
   

  

 Why Lovable?
   

  

 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. Solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We’re at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.
   

  

 What we’re looking for
   

  

* 5+ years of years experience, shipping web experiences users genuinely love
* Portfolio demonstrating landing pages and advanced web interactions (if you don’t have a portfolio of landing pages - check out our other roles)
* Ability to make smart trade-offs between speed and polish, knowing when to ship and when to refine
* Expertise in frontend, either as a front-end developer or a designer who ships
* Experience translating scrappy explorations into production-ready experiences
* Strong design sense with an eye for detail, accessibility, and usability
* Ideally - you push the boundaries of the web with technologies like WebGL


 What you’ll do
   

  

 In one sentence: Own and elevate landing pages and web experiences that help share Lovable with the world.
   

  

* Build landing pages that delight, also designing interactions or pairing closely with designers
* Implement web interactions in React/TypeScript with obsessive attention to performance, responsiveness, and cross-browser consistency
* Drive front-end execution - pioneering new interaction patterns, micro-animations, and delightful details that elevate the entire experience
* Collaborate with marketing, helping share Lovable with the world
* Explore and iterate on visual designs with designers, translating explorations into scalable, web-native implementations
* Build and maintain reusable components that enhance consistency while enabling creativity across both product and marketing


 Our tech stack
   

  

 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React, Tailwind
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, , infra-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

 How we hire
   

  

* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with recruiter.
* Show us some of your work you’re really proud of.
* Show us how you approach problems during several technical interviews.
* In some cases, we may opt to do paid, trial work.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal
* For this role, we're prioritising candidates based in Stockholm and London, however we'd consider remote for truly exceptional applicants

title: IT developer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 Är du redo att utveckla smarta integrationer och lösningar för att underlätta för alla våra medarbetare? Vill du vara med på resan att bidra till att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag?
   

  

 Som IT Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att designa, utveckla och implementera sömlösa integrationer mellan våra interna system. Du kommer att arbeta med att effektivisera processer, förbättra medarbetarupplevelsen och säkerställa att våra system kommunicerar effektivt med varandra.
   

  

 Vad mer kommer du att göra:
   

  

* Designa, utveckla och implementera integrationer mellan interna system.
* Utveckla och underhålla robusta integrationer mellan HR-system, IT-servicehanteringsverktyg och andra applikationer
* Identifiera och implementera processförbättringar genom systemintegration
* Samarbeta med Corporate IT-teamet för att förstå deras behov av användarhantering
* Tillsammans med våra Business Automation Enablers samarbeta med övriga organisationen för att förstå, möta och effektivisera deras behov
* Utveckla enligt gällande riktlinjer och praxis
* Arbeta med förbättringar och buggrättning
* Kodgranskning
* Skriva tester och dokumentera lösningarna
* Leverera enligt uppsatta kriterier - Definition of Done


**Vår teknikstack**
 Go | Java | Rust | PostgreSQL | S3 | K8s | Git
   

  

**Vad du får**
 Du kommer att ingå ett kompetent autonomt team med fokus på att skapa integrationer mellan interna system.
   

  

 Hos oss bygger teamen sin egen teamkultur och ramverk och arbetar med moderna lösningar med öppen källkod. Fortnox tror även på ett liv i balans och ”Fortnox MåBra” är ett koncept som finns för ditt välmående och återhämtning. Vidare tror vi också på flexibilitet, vilket betyder att obligatorisk klocka på, klocka av är bara inte vår grej och självklart finns det möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi ser gärna att du har arbetat minst ett par år med programmering och att du har erfarenhet av molnbaserade lösningar och API-hantering. Gärna också erfarenhet av databashantering och SQL. Du har kunskap om agila arbetsmetoder, men framför allt tycker du det är riktigt kul med utveckling och vill skapa bra upplevelser för alla våra medarbetare.
   

  

 I den här tjänsten är det också viktigt att du är duktig på och har erfarenhet av integrationer med olika typer av API. Har du dokumenterad erfarenhet av användarhantering i molnbaserade lösningar, SCIM samt en förståelse för onboarding och IT Service Management är det meriterande.
   

  

 Vidare är du en kreativ och initiativrik lagspelare som sätter laget före jaget. Du är nyfiken och frågvis och delar gärna med dig av dina kunskaper och erfarenheter, i och utanför teamet. Du har en god förmåga att göra dig förstådd inom både tal och skrift på såväl svenska som engelska.
   

  

 Tjänsten är baserad på vårt kontor i Stockholm alternativt på vårt huvudkontor i Växjö, men det går självklart bra att jobba hemifrån några dagar i veckan om det önskas!

title: Mainframe Developer
description:
**Role: Mainframe Developer** 




**Type: Contract (B2B)** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





**Job Description:** 



* Experience working with COBOL-based mainframe systems
* Knowledge of ChangeMan, DB2, IBM z/OS, JCL, and MQ messaging

title: Senior F&O Developer
description:
As a Senior F&O Developer / Architect, you will play a central role in designing, developing, and optimizing enterprise-grade Dynamics 365 F&O solutions. You will work closely with functional consultants, business stakeholders, and fellow architects to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions that support critical business processes.
 



 Please note you musy be in Sweden for the role.
 



 You will act both as a
 **hands-on technical expert** 
 and a
 **technical leader** 
 , guiding development teams and ensuring architectural integrity across projects.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* Design and define technical architecture for Dynamics 365 F&O solutions
* Develop high-quality X++ code, extensions, and integrations following best practices
* Lead technical design decisions and review code and solutions
* Collaborate with functional consultants to translate business requirements into technical solutions
* Design and implement integrations using APIs, Data Entities, Azure services, and Power Platform
* Ensure performance, security, maintainability, and scalability of solutions
* Support upgrades, releases, and DevOps processes (CI/CD, build & release pipelines)
* Mentor and support junior developers and technical team members



 Required Skills & Experience
 


* Extensive experience with
 **Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations**
* Strong expertise in
 **X++ development** 
 , extensions, and D365 F&O architecture
* Solid understanding of
 **ERP processes** 
 (Finance, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, or similar)
* Experience with
 **Azure** 
 , integrations, and the Power Platform
* Strong knowledge of
 **DevOps** 
 , version control, and release management
* Experience in technical leadership or solution architecture roles
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to quality



 Nice to Have
 


* Experience as a
 **Technical Architect** 
 on large or complex D365 F&O implementations
* Microsoft certifications within Dynamics 365 or Azure
* Experience working in international or multi-country ERP projects

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och ödmjuk Engineering Manager konsult som vill leda genom förtroende, tydlighet och närvaro. Du brinner för att skapa förutsättningar för andra att lyckas och trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik, produkt och verksamhet. Tillsammans med utvecklare, QA, produktägare och arkitekter driver du fram robusta, skalbara och användarcentrerade lösningar – med fokus på hållbarhet över tid.
   

  

 Som Engineering Manager får du en nyckelroll i att omsätta mål och strategier till välfungerande leveranser. Du arbetar nära dina team för att coacha, undanröja hinder och säkerställa att vi bygger rätt saker på rätt sätt. Ditt ledarskap är inlyssnande och förankrande: du bjuder in till dialog, samlar team och intressenter kring beslut, och säkerställer att förändringar är förankrade innan de genomförs. Du mäter hellre effekt än aktivitet och bygger kultur genom exempel, feedback och transparens.
   

  

 Hos oss är det agila arbetssättet mer än en metod – det är vår kultur. Vi levererar inkrementellt med täta dialoger med beställare och användare, så att värde uppstår kontinuerligt och lösningarna blir ändamålsenliga och långsiktigt hållbara.
   

  

 Här får du möjligheten att leda i en miljö där ditt ledarskap, din tekniska förståelse och din förmåga att skapa värde verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har flerårig erfarenhet av att leda ingenjörsteam (t.ex. som Engineering Manager, Team Lead eller liknande).
* Har bakgrund inom tech – som utvecklare/arkitekt eller i ledande roll på tech-bolag.
* Leder med ödmjukhet: lyssnar aktivt, förankrar beslut, skapar delaktighet och driver kontinuerlig förbättring.
* Är van att arbeta agilt i tvärfunktionella team och att balansera teknisk kvalitet, leveranstakt och affärsnytta.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska i tal och skrift; svenska är meriterande.


 Meriterande erfarenheter:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från produktnära eller tekniktunga miljöer.
* Vana att arbeta i moderna utvecklings- och leveransmiljöer.
* Samarbete med ledning och andra seniora intressenter kring mål, prioriteringar och roadmap.
* Erfarenhet av organisationer där långsiktighet, kvalitet och användarnytta är centrala.
* Bidragit till utveckling av arbetssätt, processer eller teamstruktur i växande organisationer.


 Ditt uppdrag i praktiken:
   

  

* Coacha och utveckla människor och team – mål, feedback, karriärvägar och välmående.
* Säkerställa teknisk riktning tillsammans med arkitektur och produkt – från strategi till leverans.
* Förankra beslut tvärfunktionellt och facilitera prioritering utifrån data och effekt.
* Driva förbättringar inom kvalitet, flöde och säkerhet (t.ex. CI/CD, incidentprocess, SLO/SLI).


 English summery:
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced and humble Engineering Manager who leads through trust, clarity, and presence. You will support and coach engineering teams, enabling collaboration and building robust, scalable, and user-centered solutions with long-term sustainability in focus.
   

  

 You thrive at the intersection of technology, product, and business, and bring a background from tech – either as a developer/architect or in a leadership role. Experience from product-focused or technology-driven environments is meriting. Fluency in English is required; Swedish is a plus.
   

  

 Kontakta ansvarig kontaktperson Philip vid frågor, philip.leopoldson@adavo.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Lead Developer (Python)
description:
Lead Python Developer – AI, Real-Time Video & Enterprise Projects
 



  





 An exciting opportunity has opened up for a Lead Python Developer to join a fast-growing tech company working directly with HP and Microsoft on cutting-edge projects involving AI, real-time video processing, and enterprise-grade software.
 



  





 This is a hands-on leadership role where you’ll oversee a small team of Python developers (3 people) and act as the go-to technical lead for major enterprise projects. You’ll work closely with both the CTO and COO, helping steer critical decisions and shaping the future of the product.
 



  





 Responsibltiies
 



 🚀 Lead development on a key project
 



 👨‍💻 Stay hands-on while guiding a team of 3 Python developers
 



 🎥 Work on real-time audio/video processing and AI pipelines
 



 🤝 Collaborate directly with leadership to define project direction
 



 📦 Package applications using Nuitka and build for enterprise environments
 



 🧠 Contribute to innovation in AI and ML tooling
 



  





 Requirements:
 



 🐍 5+ years of strong Python development experience
 



 🧭 Prior leadership experience or strong desire to lead
 



 🗣️ Clear communicator who can explain technical concepts to stakeholders
 



 Beneficial:
 



 🎥 Experience with video/audio processing in real-time environments
 



 📦 Familiarity with Nuitka and enterprise deployment
 



 🧠 Background in AI/ML pipeline development
 



  





 What's on offer?
 



 💡 Direct impact on high-profile projects with HP & Microsoft
 



 🏢 Flat, collaborative structure – work closely with execs
 



 🔥 Passionate, low-ego team building something meaningful
 



 🍽️ Weekly company lunches with a private chef
 



 🎉 Positive team culture with high retention and shared purpose
 



 🎯 Work on exciting, future-focused tech with real-world impact
 



  





 This role is based in Sweden with hybrid flexibility. Candidates must be able to attend the Täby office 1–2 times per week.

title: SOFTWARE APPLICATION ENGINEER WITHIN RAILWAY SIGNALING
description:
As a Software Application Engineer at our client, you will have the opportunity to develop and configure software for specialized railway signaling systems.
   

  

 By working closely with system engineers and project teams, you will directly contribute to reliable solutions used in both Swedish and international railway networks.
   

  

**Working as a Software Application Engineer**
 A Software Application Engineer working within Signaling System Specific Application team plays a key role in developing and configuring software that ensures safe and efficient train operations. They work with specialized railway signaling systems that communicate with trains to control speed, movement, and track usage.
   

  

 This role involves adapting and integrating software to meet the unique requirements of each railway project, often in close collaboration with system engineers and project teams. The engineer also performs testing, validation, and troubleshooting to ensure the software functions reliably in real-world conditions. Their work directly contributes to the safety and performance of rail networks in Sweden and across the globe.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design basis documents corresponds
* Design basis products corresponds to Generic Products and Generic Application which includes both SW as well as process descriptions, instructions and application information detailing how to execute.
* Create and deliver specific application software configuration and documentation in accordance with applicable internal procedures for Configuration and Change Management to secure quality and safety.


**Being a consultant at Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent specialize in giving young tech talents the ultimate start in their careers. For this role, you will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent but work at our customers site. You will be coached by a a consultant manager at Nexer Tech Talent. As a consultant, you will be well taken care of. We often invite our consultants to group activities such as lectures, after works and lunch meetings.
   

  

**Desired qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or a related field, or equivalent work experience. A degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Railway Engineering is considered a plus.
* Relevant experience required in a similar role or railway signalling knowledge.
* Safety and system related engineering experience.
* Experience of development according to safety standards such as CENELEC (EN50126, EN50128, EN50129) or equivalent.
* Computer knowledge for example installation of operating systems, drivers and network configuration.
* Relevant experience working with requirements, specifications and documentation of complex technical systems.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Application**
 Does this sound like you? We are constantly screening resumes, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter Kristofer Hedlund at kristofer.hedlund@nexergroup.com We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 16 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent here.

title: IAM Software Developer
description:
We’re looking for an
 **IAM** 
**Software Developer** 
 at WIAM team to join us at Telia.
   

  

 I’m Mažvydas Šimkus, Head of Workforce Identity & Access Management, and I’m searching for someone ready to grow with us. We’re a supportive, forward-thinking team focused on shaping the future of Identity & Access Management by driving secure, scalable IAM solutions across Telia’s enterprise.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 Participate in the development and maintenance of IAM/IGA infrastructure and services. You will:
   

  

* Develop and maintain customizations in a Java based IAM product.
* Write and maintain automation scripts.
* Contribute to implementing best practice designs in IAM integrations.
* Support database operations for PostgreSQL and Linux servers.
* Perform routine administration of CI/CD pipelines in Github and Podman containers.
* Learn/deepen your knowledge of the MidPoint IAM product and Identity Governance overall.


**What will help you thrive in this role:**
 You are a proactive learner with strong communication skills and a passion for secure and robust identity solutions. You also have:
   

  

* Proficiency in Java, JavaScript and/or experience with IT Architecture, IAM related roles and system operations.
* Experience in automation scripting using languages such as Groovy, Python and PowerShell.
* Understanding of IAM/IGA principles and putting security first.
* Familiarity with containers (Podman/Kubernetes), PostgreSQL, Linux and DevOps principles and tooling.


**We also work and would consider as an advantage experience with:**
* Products: Omada Enterprise Server, Ping Directory, Axiomatics Policy-driven Authorization, Microsoft Windows servers and Helisoft Helios.
* Technologies: HTTP API development, C#, ASP.NET, JS/React web apps, Blazor web apps, MS SQL server, Policy-as-Code (PaC), Grafana monitoring and OAuth/OIDC authentication.


**Join us to shape smarter living for people, businesses, and the planet**
 At Telia, we’re a team of 15 000 colleagues across the Nordics and Baltics, passionate about technology and connectivity. As a Leading Telecommunications Operator & Climate Leader, we drive change with large-scale, impactful projects while building a sustainable, inclusive world.
   

  

 Here, you can grow your skills, lead meaningful projects, and thrive in a supportive, diverse environment. Whether you’re taking your first step or your next, Telia is a place to grow, belong, and make a real impact.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We look forward to receiving your application by
 **January** 
**16, 2026** 
 . Please note that we might close the position earlier if we find the right candidate, so don’t wait too long to apply!
   

  

 If you’re selected for the next stage, you’ll be contacted by either our Talent Acquisition Partner or the Hiring Manager. Background and reference checks will be part of the process.
   

  

 Want to know more about this role? Please reach out to Mažvydas Šimkus at mazvydas.simkus@teliacompany.com or LinkedIn.
   

  

**Equal opportunities**
 At Telia, we recognize talent by professional skills and growth potential. We champion diversity, ensuring every individual’s needs are met, regardless of disability, gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation, or social status. Together, we’re dedicated to fostering an inclusive work environment where your uniqueness is our strength.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen - together!**

title: C++ Engineer - Platform Engineering
description:
The CI Experience squad owns the client continuous integration (CI) infrastructure at Spotify. Our mission is to ensure smooth, reliable, and fast integration of code changes across all client repositories. We provide the tooling, documentation, and support that empower client engineers to build, test, and ship confidently.
   

  

 We’re evolving our CI platform to meet the growing complexity of Spotify’s client ecosystem. Spanning Android, iOS, desktop, and embedded platforms, by building scalable, maintainable systems and best practices for continuous delivery.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Own and evolve CI infrastructure for Spotify’s client engineering organisation.
* Improve build reliability, performance, and observability across client codebases.
* Contribute to the technical roadmap for CI systems, defining standards for build and integration practices.
* Develop and maintain automation in Python and C++, and work across environments including Windows.
* Collaborate with multiple product and platform squads to ensure CI systems align with developer needs.
* Troubleshoot complex build failures and support engineers in adopting best CI/CD practices.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Experienced with CI infrastructure and internal developer workflows.
* Proficient in Python and C++, with understanding of Bazel, gRPC/Protobuf, and Git.
* Comfortable working in Windows, with experience in Batch and PowerShell scripting.
* Confident working across multiple client platforms (Android, iOS, Web, Smart/Ubiquity devices).
* Deep understanding of software architecture, scalable build systems, and CI/CD fundamentals.
* A pragmatic problem-solver with excellent collaboration and communication skills.
* Passionate about improving developer experience through automation, simplification, and tooling excellence.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior Developer - TRATON Group R&D
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 In this role, you will work in an environment where collaboration and a deep understanding of user needs guide every decision. By working closely with colleagues, customers, and stakeholders across the TRATON ecosystem, you help create solutions that are technically strong and genuinely meaningful for the people who rely on them. Our values — customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste — shape how we work and grow together.
   

  

 We are now seeking a Senior Developer to design, build, and optimize secure, scalable, high-performing software solutions supporting critical automotive and connected vehicle systems.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, build, and refine modern software services. By engaging with users and stakeholders, you translate real needs into effective technical solutions. You help shape our evolving scope, apply strong architectural thinking, and integrate APIs across vehicle, cloud, and enterprise systems.
   

  

 You mentor others, support continuous improvement, and work iteratively — allowing ideas to evolve, even if it means leaving some behind. Facilitate teamwork through coaching and clear communication, helping teams reach high performance.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You believe that understanding users is essential to building the right solutions, and you thrive when collaborating with others to solve complex problems. You adapt easily to change and work iteratively, allowing ideas to evolve — even if it means leaving some behind for better ones. Clear communication helps you create alignment within the team, and your curiosity and modern development mindset drive continuous learning and improvement.
   

  

 You have 10+ years of experience working across diverse software projects, giving you a solid foundation in modern development practices and architectural thinking. You are proficient in several programming languages, such as Python, Java, Kotlin, and TypeScript, and you’re comfortable building services with frameworks like Ktor. You bring experience with event-driven architectures, API integration, Git, and relevant toolchains such as Polarion. Familiarity with LSP, requirements, and test management.
   

  

 If you also have experience in automotive embedded development or an understanding of vehicle software architecture and connectivity, it is a merit.
   

  

**TRATON Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job Express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-01-12. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Erica Åström Szorath, Head of Requirement Management System, erica.astrom.szorath@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Description**
 Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting
   

  

 services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna, northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

 Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?
   

  

 Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?
   

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as Data Engineer in our Business Intelligence Team. We are looking for a dedicated person who shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.
   

  

 We are looking for a results-driven Data Engineer/BI-developer to join our team and help shape the foundation of our data and analytics infrastructure. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data systems and pipelines that enable timely, accurate, and meaningful business insights. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, particularly finance, to translate business requirements into actionable data models, reports, and dashboards.
   

  

**Requirements**
**YOUR ROLE**
 As a Data Engineer, your primary focus will be building and optimizing our data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will work to extract and transform raw data from various sources, ensuring it is well-structured and accessible for analysis and reporting. You will design and implement end-to-end BI solutions using the Microsoft BI stack, including Power BI, SSIS, and SSAS (OLAP and Tabular), and ensure data quality and reliability across all reporting platforms.
   

  

 In addition to technical development, you will collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, provide support for financial reporting processes such as budgeting and forecasting, and contribute to the enforcement of data governance and best practices. You’ll be expected to continuously monitor and improve the performance of BI systems while staying aligned with evolving business needs.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**WHO YOU ARE**
**We See That You Bring Experience In The Following**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or a related field.
* Proven experience in Business Intelligence, data engineering, or a similar analytical role.
* Strong experience designing and optimizing on-premise data warehouses.
* Expertise in Microsoft BI stack: Power BI, SSIS, SSAS (OLAP and Tabular).
* Proficient in SQL and Python programming with advanced skills in data modelling and database design.
* Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes and data integration techniques.
* Familiarity with data governance, data quality frameworks, and security best practices.
* Experience with dimensional modelling and methodologies such as Kimball, star, and snowflake schemas.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a collaborative approach to working in cross-functional teams.
* Knowledge of financial data structures and reporting, including budgeting and forecasting.


**Additional Desirable Skills**
* Experience supporting Finance or FP&A teams with BI and reporting solutions.
* Familiarity with financial systems or ERP platforms (e.g., D365 F&O, SAP, Oracle).
* Experience using collaboration and project management tools such as JIRA and Confluence.


**Benefits**
 WE OFFER YOU
   

  

* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.


**Additional Benefits**
* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligible employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


  

  

 LOCATION
   

  

 This is a full-time, permanent position based at our office in Solna.
   

  

 FURTHER INFORMATION
   

  

 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

 NEXT STEP
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. You can submit your application up until 2025-01-18, which is the latest possible date for consideration.
   

  

 We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

 WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

 Required Skills QualificationsTechnical Expertise
