 You have ideally worked in environments serving both SMBs (Business) and Consumers, or have a strong track record in complex, multi-product ecosystems.
* **The "Builder" Mindset:** 
 You have a history of shipping products that solve hard problems. You don't just optimize buttons; you build value propositions that drive organic growth.
* **Experimentation Toolkit:** 
 You are deeply familiar with A/B testing frameworks, funnel analysis, and growth metrics. You know how to design a valid experiment and when to kill a losing one.



  





**Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚** 




 Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture,
 
 click here
 
 .
 



  





**Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let's find out more!** 




 While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on
 
 LinkedIn
 
 for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our
 
 Instagram
 
 for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our
 
 blog
 
 for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰
 



*Depending on the regulations in the country where you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.*

title: Business Control & Transformation Lead
description:
Does the opportunity of help building the most modern Legal, Risk, Ethics and Sustainability organization in an international environment appeal to you? In the position as Head of Business Control & Transformation you work closely with and report directly to Senior Vice President General Counsel at Securitas Group, who oversees Legal, Risk, Ethics and Sustainability and is part of Group Management. You will be instrumental in driving the strategic transformation of Securitas global Legal, Risk, Ethics and Sustainability operations. Since this role is new, there are significant opportunities to influence the content and scope.
 



  





 The position is based at Securitas’ head office on Kungsholmen in Stockholm and will include collaboration with local teams and stakeholders across 36 markets in the world.
 



  





**About the position** 




 Securitas is undergoing an exciting transformation to build a modern and efficient Legal, Risk, Ethics and Sustainability function. In this role you will play a pivotal role in shaping and driving this change journey. A key focus will be managing and optimizing the global spend - by developing models, tools and insights that bring transparency, accountability and performance to how services are managed globally.
 



  





 You will lead initiatives to improve internal cost allocations, validate financial assumptions and develop strategic business cases to support the ongoing transformation. While the ambition and vision are clear, the implementation roadmap is yet to be defined - and that’s where you come in.
 



  





 You will work closely with stakeholders across Group Management and collaborate with the global Legal, Risk, Ethics and Sustainability leadership team, giving you high exposure and impact. Your ability to navigate between strategic thinking and hands-on execution will be critical to succeed in this role.
 



  





**Your main responsibilities will include** 



* Lead and drive the strategic transformation of the global Legal, Risk, Ethics and Sustainability function, including organizational design and development.
* Take ownership of budget and forecasting processes for the global spend.
* Develop financial models and strategic business cases to support key decisions.
* Validate and analyze financial data related to costs across regions.
* Support stakeholders with decision-making materials on both operational and strategic matters.
* Initiate and lead improvement initiatives aimed at increasing efficiency and automation – including AI-driven solutions.
* Ensure a strong business lens on all initiatives and drive alignment so that the Legal, Risk, Ethics & Sustainability function consistently supports, enables, and accelerates the company’s business strategy and client value proposition.



  





**Your profile and qualifications** 




 You are proud of your combination of excellent analytical skills, ability to communicate professionally and convincingly, as well as the way you quickly and intuitively identify the core of a problem. You are result-oriented, feel confident in your ability to get things done, and never leave your deliverables only partly completed. As you will work closely with stakeholders of different levels in the organization all around the world, you understand the perspectives and priorities of your main internal contacts and adapt your way of communicating accordingly. Finally, you are business-oriented with an optimistic mindset, seeing possibilities in challenges and thrive in a changing environment.
 



  





 Since the role is new, you will have the opportunity to shape and make your mark on it. There will be significant opportunities for growth in various areas, tailored to your interests and experience.
 



  





 You hold a Master’s or bachelor’s degree in finance, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field with at least 5 years of relevant working experience. You probably either are, or have been, working in Management Consulting or as a Project Manager with focus on strategy, finance, or transformation. You are fluent in English and have excellent skills in Microsoft Office products, especially Excel and PowerPoint. Spanish is a plus.
 



  





**How to apply** 




 In this recruitment process, Securitas is working with Prodiem. Selection will be ongoing, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible at our website, www.prodiem.se For further information regarding the position, please contact Petra Bennarp at Prodiem at 070-916 39 18.
 



  





**Securitas AB** 




*Securitas is a world-leading safety and security solutions partner that helps make your world a safer place. By leveraging technology in partnership with our clients, we offer a broad portfolio of value-enhancing services and solutions integrated across the security value chain – from on-site services to advanced monitoring, comprehensive risk prediction and advisory services.* 




  





*With around 340 000 employees in 44 markets, our innovative, holistic approach with local and global expertise makes us a trusted business partner to many of the world’s best-known companies. Benefitting from nine decades of deep experience and guided by our values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness, we create sustainable value by helping our clients optimize their operations and protect what matters most – their people and assets.*

title: Transaction Advisory Student Program 2026
description:
**Do you want to grow in your self-leadership while boosting the collaborative and learning culture within PwC? Are you interested in transactional advisory and business opportunities that contribute to building a better world?**
*Take this opportunity and join the PwC Transaction advisory Student program and be a part of an enriching journey!*
 In a world of constant change, the need to know what to do, and how to do it, has never been more important. PwC is one of the world’s leading consultancy firms, helping companies across a wide range of industries with complex business challenges.
   

  

 With our deep industry experience and international networks, we help clients to succeed all across the deals/transaction cycle.
   

  

 We are now looking for students doing primarily Bachelor and Master programs within Finance, Industrial Economy, and Real Estate economics to join our student program during Spring 2026.
   

  

**Are you one of them?**
 You will be part of an engaged and collaborative team of around 30 students per program and learn more about our business, our people, our culture and our purpose and of course create a great network for the future.
   

  

**What You Get Through PwC Transaction Advisory Student Program**
 Each program consists of four sessions, circa 3,5 - 4 hrs (16.00 - 19.30/20.00), onsite at PwC:s office in Stockholm (Torsgatan 21) incl mingles after each session.
   

  

**Program during Spring 2026**
 Sessions are held on March 11, March 25, April 15, May 6
   

  

 Through workshops, lectures and engaging conversations we will focus on Deals & Advisory services, transaction related case training, self-leadership development and PwC culture. Network activities and mentorships are also included in the program to help you build relationships for the future. You will also get training for your future recruitment process and how you can genuinely pitch yourself.
   

  

**Skills We Are Looking For**
 An on-going Bachelor or first year of Master's degree in Finance & Accounting, Industrial Economics, Real Estate Economics or Data Analytics & Programming combined with Finance.
   

  

 You enjoy analytical and problem solving work, and are motivated to understand and navigate complexity. You are keen on the consultant role and you are a great communicator or plan to become one!
   

  

 We think you are a curious person motivated to learn new things, people will always turn to you as a go-to-person and they will describe you as friendly, kind and a true relation builder.
   

  

 You will have a need of being proficient in both business English and Swedish. But most important - you have an open mindset and you are willing to create value.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Application instructions**
 Please register your application consisting of
   

  

* CV
* Available university and high school grades
* Motivational letter about why this sounds exciting for you


 Your application should be complete in order for us to be able to revise it.
   

  

 The reviewing process is ongoing until February 3, and the applicants moving onwards will be contacted for a shorter online interview which will take place in week 7-8. You will get a final reply by February 26 at the latest.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the program, your application or the process, please contact Amanda Gustafsson amanda.g.gustafsson@pwc.com or Victoria Lakomova victoria.lakomova@pwc.com

title: Product Manager Humicool Product & Media
description:
**Product Manager - Humidification**
**About Munters**
 Munters is a global leader in energy-efficient air treatment and climate solutions. Using innovative technologies, Munters creates the perfect climate for customers in a wide range of industries. Munters has been defining the future of air treatment since 1955. Today, around 4,000 employees carry out manufacturing and sales in more than 30 countries.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.munters.com.
   

  

 We are a world leading supplier of climate solutions for the future. We offer innovative, efficient and sustainable solutions for customers in industries where controlling indoor humidity, temperature and energy efficiency is mission-critical.
   

  

 Together we work to support our customers in creating a healthier planet. Come work for us and be a part of this exciting journey.
   

  

**Key Duties & Responsibilities**
 As a Member of the Product Management team within Munters AirTech Business Area you will have a key role in developing, introducing and maintaining a successful and strategic important portfolio of products and services at Munters. This is an exciting business-oriented role that combines strategic thinking and product management in a market leading company in the humidity control technology (HCT) industry. It is also an opportunity to be part of shaping a growth journey with Munters AirTech.
   

  

 You will work cross-functionally to develop impactful and innovative revenue-generating products and services by driving product ideation, product requirements, value propositions, business cases, and solid go-to-market strategies together with the team.
   

  

 You will join a dynamic environment and the role requires you to work with global cross-functional teams and multiple stakeholders to ensure the Product Portfolio is profitable and the roadmap is in line with AirTech strategy.
   

  

 An understanding of industrial B2B is desired and a strong business acumen as well as understating of sustainability is a must. You have great people management and organizing skills and communicate with ease both verbally and in writing. Proven track record in working successfully across departments to achieve a goal is a plus. English is required, other languages are an advantage. Our ideal candidate has a natural drive and a willingness to change, as well as a strong customer focus with a pro-active can-do attitude.
   

  

 You will report to the manager of EMEA Product Management who is a part of the AirTech Global Product Management team.
   

  

**The position requires some travel internationally. We encourage applicants from any location with a Munters office or manufacturing facility.**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage and drive the product life cycle.
* Interact with Sales and customers to understand current and future needs.
* Evaluate market needs and give directions to R&D on product modifications and upgrades, and new product developments.
* Initiate new product development projects, ensure alignment with the strategy and secure that deadlines are met.
* Support the AirTech strategies by creating clear product strategy and roadmap.
* Communicate the roadmap to key stakeholders and work with Marketing, Sales, Service sales, Operations and R&D to derivate a strong value proposition.
* Keep up-to-date and improve product marketing material and content to highlight the values of the product portfolio for the respective targeted market segments.
* Increase product profitability throughout the product life cycle, including services products such as spare parts, service kits & upgrade solutions.
* Provide high-level technical support for a wide range of products.
* Gain and maintain in-depth knowledge of products and applications, to support and increase competency within our sales organization.


**Education /Knowledge/ Skills / Ability**
* A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business administration or similar work experience.
* Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in B2B commercial or industrial HVAC industry in Product Application Management or R&D.
* Experience from working in a global matrix organization.
* A strong business acumen and a high-level of technical knowledge.
* Strong communication skills in multicultural environment.
* Team player with ‘Can do’ attitude, strong customer focus and drive for results.
* Excellent planning and organizing skills and communicate with ease both verbally and in writing.
* Fluent in English, other languages a plus.


**What We Offer**
* The power of influence - We believe in giving our employees the freedom to experiment and solve meaningful problems in their roles. Working with us is never boring.
* A flexible work environment - Happier employees are more productive and motivated.
* Able to work globally locally – We are big enough to make a difference globally and small enough to provide a caring family atmosphere locally.
* Contribute to a healthier planet – We make sure windmills and bridges don´t rust and that plants and animals enjoy a healthy indoor climate.


**Interested in joining Munters?**
 If you are excited about this opportunity, please submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 To help us place the right people in the right role, we follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, knowledge and attributes relevant to Munters will be assessed.
   

  

 At Munters, you get the chance to influence and solve meaningful problems for society. We lead with a passion for climate, with people in the core and sustainability as part of the DNA.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare till vår kund i Stockholm
description:
Vill du driva utvecklingen framåt och arbeta med affärskritiska lösningar i en modern, agil miljö? Nu söker vi en
 **Senior Fullstackutvecklare** 
 till ett uppdrag i Stockholm.
   

  

**OM UPPDRAGET**
 Som Senior Fullstackutvecklare blir du en del av Business Support-enheten och arbetar i ett agilt team med utveckling och förvaltning av interna system som stöttar verksamheten. Rollen kräver både teknisk bredd och djup samt förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i komplexa problemställningar och hitta hållbara lösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att bidra genom hela utvecklingskedjan – från kravdialog till implementation, test och kvalitetssäkring.
   

  

**ARBETSUPPGIFTER**
* Samarbeta tätt med produktägare, slutanvändare och andra intressenter
* Utveckla, testa och kvalitetssäkra kod
* Arbeta med både manuella och automatiserade tester
* Stötta manuella systemtester vid behov
* Bidra till förbättring av arbetssätt, arkitektur och tekniska lösningar


**OM TEAMET**
 Du blir en del av ett agilt team som tillsammans levererar smarta, hållbara och högkvalitativa lösningar. Teamet präglas av samarbete, innovation och kontinuerligt lärande i en inkluderande och stödjande miljö där varje individs kompetens tas tillvara.
   

  

**DIN PROFIL**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en lagspelare som brinner för kvalitet och trivs i en dynamisk vardag. Du är proaktiv, flexibel och har ett lösningsorienterat mindset.
   

  

**Krav**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som utvecklare
* Gedigen erfarenhet av:
+ Angular
+ .NET-plattformen
+ C#
+ Entity Framework
+ Azure
+ Azure Functions
+ Logic Apps
+ DevOps

* Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av Azure Pipelines / CI/CD
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Tidigare erfarenhet som Lead Developer


**Uppdragsinformation**
* Start: Omgående
* Uppdragslängd: 12 månader med option på förlängning
* Omfattning: 100 %


**Ansökan**
**Vänligen Skicka In**
* Uppdaterat CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* Kort motivering till varför du är lämplig för uppdraget


**OM WISE IT**
 Wise IT är specialister på rekrytering, konsultlösningar och strategisk kompetensmatchning inom IT och tech. Teknik förändras snabbt , men med rätt person på rätt plats får du kontroll på framtiden. Vi matchar människor med skarp teknisk kompetens och förmågan att förstå helheten. Resultatet? IT som fungerar i praktiken, inte bara i teorin. Vi ser till att du inte bara följer utvecklingen utan driver den.

title: Operational Risk Management Freelance Consultant
description:
**Job Description**
 As an Operational Risk Management Consultant, you will work with industry-leading clients across your sectors to reduce risks and improve business continuity and asset productivity. You’ll save lives, drive performance and improve the working lives of all your clients’ employees.
   

  

 As a freelance consultant, you will work with our team to deliver coaching and support to our clients to help evolve their culture and behaviours when it comes to safety and risk management. This will involve working closely with managers and supervisors on site with the client, supporting and coaching them in the implementation of dss+ methodologies.
   

  

 Key responsibilities will include;
   

  

* You will work as a coach to help change the culture and underlying behaviours relating to safety and risk management.
* You will be working on the client site as part of the dss+ team - this will involve staying overnight throughout the week


**Job Requirements**
 At dss+, we embrace and celebrate diversity. Above all, we are an inclusive culture in which everyone contributes and has the chance to develop their talents further.
   

  

 Ideally, you will hold a degree/master’s degree in engineering or a business-related field, coupled with experience in management consulting and coaching with previous exposure to operational risk management, safety, and/or culture change.
   

  

 You demonstrate experience and an understanding of the operational issues in heavy industries such as mining or heavy industry.
   

  

 You have a deep understanding of safety and operational risk management (ORM) within mining or heavy manufacturing sectors and will be able to leverage that experience in coaching others to adopt new behaviours as part of a new culture.
   

  

 You will be fluent in Swedish and English and can work in both languages fluently.

title: Scrum Master/RTE
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är dedikerade experter inom industri, energi och infrastruktur och skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har nordiska rötter med global räckvidd. Våra gemensamma principer – Result driven, Client centric, Empowering och Accountable – vägleder oss i hur vi arbetar, utvecklas och lyckas tillsammans. Var med och accelerera övergången till ett hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker nu hängivna Scrum Masters och Release Train Engineers (RTE) som tror på den agila metoden.
   

  

 På sektionen Project Management inom enheten Connected Products så kommer du att få jobba med produktutveckling av högteknologiska och intelligenta produkter för framtidens hållbara värld. Som Scrum Master/RTE hos oss på AFRY blir du en del av ett fantastiskt och otroligt kompetent gäng kollegor som tillsammans arbetar för att skapa innovativa och hållbara lösningar tillsammans med våra kunder. Vi arbetar brett med kunder i många olika branscher, allt ifrån banker och mobilitet till de vassaste produktbolagen i regionen.
   

  

 Som Scrum Master ansvarar du för att teamet följer den agila processen, du har ansvar för att organisera och leda planeringssessioner, sprint reviews och allt som ingår i Scrum för att leverera en bättre produkt för varje sprint. Du ansvarar också för att coacha organisationen i Scrum/agila processer
   

  

 Som Release Train Engineer(RTE) ansvarar du för att facilitera Agile Release Train (ART ) enligt SAFe ramverket, du har ansvar för att organisera och leda planeringssessioner(PI planning) reviews och allt som ingår i att leda ett ART. Du ansvarar också för att coacha Scrummasters och teamledare i den agila processen.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Din bakgrund**
* Du har flera års erfarenhet från en liknande roll eller så har du arbetat i agila team ett antal år och vill ta klivet upp till Scrum Master/RTE
* Du har minst ett par års erfarenhet av produktutveckling SW eller HW (dock ej från IT-förvaltning/drift)
* Du har relevant utbildning inom området (MSc, BSc eller liknande)
* Eftersom vi arbetar mot många internationella kunder krävs det även att du kommunicerar obehindrat såväl muntligt som skriftligt på svenska och engelska. För denna tjänst behöver du även vara bosatt i Sverige
* Du är van att organisera/leda möten och andra aktiviteter samt stötta ditt team
* Vidare har du även erfarenhet av krav och behovs-hantering och är van att sammanställa dessa till konkreta och realistiska mål


**Meriterande aspekter**
* Certifierad ScrumMaster och/eller certifierad SAFe RTE eller Agilist


 Våra värdeord Brave, Devoted & Teamplayers kännetecknar hur vi ser på oss själva. Du kommer trivas hos oss om du är en prestigelös person med fokus på långsiktighet och kvalitet. Du ser lösningar där andra ser problem vilket innebär att du även har god analytisk-och problemlösande förmåga. I rollen ingår det att coacha och stötta dina teammedlemmar vilket är något du bör ha erfarenhet av. Du trivs i och är van vid att leda agila team i en utvecklingsmiljö.
   

  

 I denna roll har du kontakt med många olika personer i verksamheten, därför är det även av stor vikt att du är en duktig kommunikatör som har förmågan att förklara det komplexa på ett enkelt sätt.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
**Välkommen med din ansökan, sista ansökningsdag är 2026-01-18.**
 Med anledning av stundande julledigheter kan återkoppling komma att dröja. Tack för förståelsen.
   

  

**Kontaktperson för frågor:**
 Ellinor Dahlqvist, Rekryteringspartner
   

  

 ellinor.dahlqvist@afry.com
   

  

 För samtliga rekryteringar på AFRY genomförs som grund alltid en ID-kontroll, referenstagning samt verifiering av utbildning.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Senior Legal Counsel
description:
**Join Our Team as a Senior Legal Counsel in Sweden!**





  
 




 Do you want to use your legal expertise to support complex projects and strategic decisions in a global organization?
 





 We are searching for an experienced
 **Senior Legal Counsel** 
 to join our team in Sweden, based in our Solna office!
 




  
 




**What drives us at Schneider Electric?**

  
 

  
   

  








 For us, impact isn’t just a term paraded across posters or social media; it’s encoded into our culture. After all, Schneider makes companies, infrastructure, buildings, homes, data centers, and entire industries more efficient and sustainable. With us, you’ll contribute to tackling the climate crisis head-on, and accelerating the
 
 energy transition
 
 the planet urgently needs. There’s a reason why we’re consistently ranked among the
 
 most sustainable companies in the world
 

 .
 





  
 




 Here, you can pursue your dream career while actively making a long-term, positive impact on the planet.
 

 With us, you’ll contribute to tackling the climate crisis head-on, and accelerating the
 
 energy transition
 




 the planet urgently needs. What’s more, we help tens of millions of people in underserved communities gain
 
 access to energy and education
 




 — so you’re making the world a fairer place, too. You’ll sit among colleagues with vastly different personal and professional backgrounds, all united by a vision of a better world. 
 





  
 





**What you’ll do**





  
 




 You will work on a wide range of commercial and legal matters to support our local commercial, industrial, R&D, and other entities (including factories and warehouses), many of which involve international elements: 
 



* **Prepare and review tenders and contracts** 
 , and support customer negotiations.
* **Review and negotiate channel partner agreements** 
 (e.g., Distribution, OEM, System Integrator, Services).
* **Draft and maintain template agreements and terms & conditions** 
 .
* **Provide pre-litigation and claims support** 
 .
* **Oversee litigation and represent the organization** 
 in matters before courts, government agencies, or other authorities to protect the organization’s legal and business interests.
* **Advise management and business units on all legal matters** 
 , including the potential impact of current and future regulations.
* **Ensure compliance** 
 with applicable Swedish and EU legal requirements and Group policies.
* **Support local real estate matters and employment law issues** 
 .
* **Provide training** 
 to management and business teams on legal and compliance topics.
* **Manage external legal service providers** 
 and prepare materials to ensure that the organization’s interests are well represented.



  
 




**Essential for the Role**




* Law degree and qualification to act as a lawyer in Sweden
* Previous professional experience from a law firm or as an in-house lawyer - preferably in sectors such as Construction, Energy, or Renewables
* Knowledge on how an in-house legal department operates and can identify and analyze critical business issues, applying legal expertise to deliver practical solutions
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.




 You are structured, analytical, and purposeful in your approach. 
 




  
 




**Why Schneider Electric?**

  


**Flexibility:**

 With our Global Flexibility at Work policy, and our hybrid work model, we empower our employees for their work-life integration.
 






**Career Development**

 : We provide a rich environment for our people to grow and learn every day through our career development model.
 






**Good Benefits**

 : Schneider Electric offers a robust benefits package to support our employees such as paid family leave, a culture of wellness and much more.
 






**Inclusive Environment**

 : 
 

 We build a culture of respect where everyone feels safe to be their authentic selves. We are fully committed to inclusion, and our policies and culture reflect this commitment
 





  
 





**So, what’s Next?**






 If you’re ready to take on a high-impact role in a dynamic environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply latest by 10th of January. We will start interviews during beginning of January. 
 

 I
 




  
 




 •
 




  
 




**Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**






 When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.
 





 IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
 





 We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
 





 Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
 





 €36 billion global revenue
   



 +13% organic growth
   



 150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   



 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
 




  
 







  
 




 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
 




  
 




*Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.* 





  
 




*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here*





*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Erfaren Enterprise Architect med affärssinne? Vi söker dig!
description:
Position Description
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens industriella landskap? Vi söker en vass och självgående Enterprise Architecture-rådgivare med ett strategiskt mindset och passion för att skapa verklig affärsnytta i komplexa organisationer. Hos oss får du arbeta med några av Sveriges mest välkända industribolag – i uppdrag där du gör skillnad på riktigt, tillsammans med andra seniora specialister.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 Som Enterprise Architect hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att driva och förankra arkitektur- och transformationsinitiativ. Vanliga uppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Ta fram och förankra EA-roadmaps och målbilder
* Rådgivning kring styrning, investeringar och förändringsinitiativ
* Bedömning och design av applikations- och informationslandskap
* Leda EA-forum och stötta beslutsfattare i strategiska teknikval
* Bygga broar mellan IT och verksamhet i transformationsresor


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet inom IT- eller verksamhetsarkitektur, strategi eller närliggande områden
* Konsulterfarenhet och vana att arbeta nära beslutsfattare
* Förmåga att kommunicera komplexa idéer på ett tydligt och affärsnära sätt
* Kommersiellt mindset och förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från tillverknings- eller byggindustrin
* Kunskap inom ett eller flera av följande områden: Industriell digitalisering / smart industri (Industry 4.0) Produktlivscykelhantering (PLM) & digitala tvillingar Informationsmodellering & datastyrning (data governance) Hållbarhetsrapportering och ESG-drivna IT-initiativ Modernisering av legacy / ERP-landskap i molnmiljöer


 Viktiga kompetenser och egenskaper:
   

  

* Strategisk och analytisk förmåga – du ser helheten och kopplar IT till affärsmål
* Arkitekturkompetens – du behärskar modellering, design och styrning
* Kommunikationsförmåga – du bygger förtroende och leder dialoger med ledning
* Förändringsledning – du har erfarenhet av att driva transformationer
* Teknisk bredd – du har koll på moderna teknologier, molnplattformar och integration


 Meriterande certifieringar är:
   

  

* TOGAF®, ArchiMate®
* Certified Business Architect (CBA®)
* SAFe® Architect / Agilist, ICP-ENT
* AWS / Azure / Google Cloud Architect
* CDMP, COBIT®


 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

  

* Möjlighet att påverka Sveriges mest spännande industriprojekt
* Kollegor som är lika kunniga som de är prestigelösa
* Flexibla arbetsformer och fokus på balans i livet
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och kunskapsdelning


 Några av våra förmåner är bland annat
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.


 Låter det intressant?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna Azra Dajic på azra.dajic@cgi.com. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
   

  

 Erfaren Enterprise Architect med affärssinne? Vi söker dig!
   

  

**Job Description**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens industriella landskap? Vi söker en vass och självgående Enterprise Architecture-rådgivare med ett strategiskt mindset och passion för att skapa verklig affärsnytta i komplexa organisationer. Hos oss får du arbeta med några av Sveriges mest välkända industribolag – i uppdrag där du gör skillnad på riktigt, tillsammans med andra seniora specialister.
