Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens analysplattform med den senaste tekniken? Hos oss får du chansen att forma Handelsbankens nya strategiska plattform för data och analys – en lösning som kommer att göra verklig skillnad för hela organisationen. Vi söker nu en engagerad Microsoft Fabric Analytics Engineer som vill vara med på resan. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Ditt team**
 I rollen som Microsoft Fabric Analytics Engineer blir du en del av ett kunnigt och engagerat team som arbetar nära affären och våra self-service-användare. Vi bygger och förvaltar både plattformar och viktiga affärsanalyser, och vi gör det tillsammans.
   

  

 Teamet ingår i Handelsbankens centrala område Data & Analytics, där vi arbetar med tekniker som Data Warehouse, Lakehouse och Advanced Analytics. Vårt uppdrag är att ge hela Handelsbanken moderna verktyg för datadrivna beslut – och våra plattformar används redan brett i organisationen.
   

  

 Vi är ett öppet och hjälpsamt team som gärna delar kunskap och stöttar varandra. Du kommer att arbeta i ett agilt leveranståg där samarbete och innovation är i fokus.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Microsoft Fabric Analytics Engineer får du en nyckelroll i att bygga, utveckla och optimera vår moderna data- och analysplattform. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Designa, konfigurera och drifta lösningar i Microsoft Fabric, till exempel i Lakehouse och Data Warehouse.
* Automatisera deployment, pipelines och miljöhantering med CI/CD och DevOps-verktyg.
* Säkerställa skalbarhet, prestanda och robusthet i plattformen.
* Övervaka och optimera kostnader, resursanvändning och datakvalitet.
* Samverka med verksamheten för att förstå behov och bidra med teknisk rådgivning.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om utvecklingen inom Microsoft Fabric och föreslå förbättringar.
* Utbilda och stödja teamet och användare när nya funktioner tas i bruk.


 Du arbetar nära data engineers, affärs analytiker, BI-utvecklare och arkitekter för att säkerställa att plattformen möter både dagens och framtidens behov.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Djupa kunskaper i Azure, Microsoft Fabric och Power BI.
* Erfarenhet av SQL, DAX, Python och ETL.
* Förståelse för hur data skapar affärsvärde.
* Flytande svenska och engelska.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från bank och finans.
* Certifiering från MS DP-600 eller DP-700


 Som person är du samarbetsorienterad och trivs med att dela kunskap och stötta både användare och kollegor. Du är lösningsorienterad, proaktiv och bidrar aktivt till att skapa strategiska och taktiska lösningar. Du bygger relationer med lätthet och tycker om att hjälpa andra. Din kommunikativa förmåga gör att du kan förklara teknik på ett sätt som skapar förståelse och engagemang hos affärsområden och användare.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad på vårt kontor på Torsgatan, Stockholm.
   

  

 Kom och hjälp oss att skapa en av Handelsbankens mest spännande plattformar – med den senaste tekniken på marknaden!
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
*Observera att urval och återkoppling kommer att påbörjas i mitten av januari. Under jul- och nyårshelgerna kan svarstider därför vara längre än vanligt.*
**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Johan Fischerström, johan.fischerstrom@handelsbanken.se
 **Talent Acquisition Partner:** 
 Johanna Rylander Raifi, johanna.rylander.raifi@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:** 
 Emma Rydell, emma.rydell@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** 
 Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se
   

  

*Som ett steg i Handelsbankens rekryteringsprocess krävs en godkänd bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat, utförd av en extern part, innan anställning kan ske.*

title: Backendutvecklare .NET/Azure till prisbelönt digitalbyrå
description:
***Att vakna på morgonen med längtan att gå till jobbet!***
 Vi har ett mål att alla som jobbar hos oss ska trivas så mycket att man vaknar med ett leende på måndag morgon. Vi är kanske inte Sveriges bästa bolag inom alla punkter men vi är Sveriges näst bästa bolag enligt Great Place to Work 2020. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi och nyfikenhet, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av.
   

  

 Rebel and Bird är ett av B3s dotterbolag som tar hand om kunders önskemål och krav och förädlar dessa till flerfaldigt prisbelönta tekniska lösningar. Du blir inte nedbunden i gamla tekniker utan får möjligheten att jobba med det senaste inom backend och utvecklas med oss varje dag. Vårt absolut tydligaste mål med verksamheten är att alla ska ha kul på jobbet. Det låter som en plattityd men det är vårt stora mål. Vi försöker (när så går) att träffas och göra roliga saker utanför arbetstid någon gång i månaden utöver julfest, sommarfest och konferenser.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Du kommer arbeta både i interna och externa åtaganden, dvs i våra egna produktutvecklingsteam där vi tar helhetsgrepp på våra kunders önskemål, från koncept till UX och publicerad webb samt ibland på konsultbasis i våra kunders team. Vi har i dagsläget tre större åtaganden men en hel del mindre inhouse-projekt och externa konsultåtaganden. Här är två större inhouse-åtaganden:
   

  

* Parks and Resorts - Vi utvecklar hela webblösningen inhouse i samarbete med kundens redaktörer och produktägare för samtliga parker. Den tekniska plattformen utvecklas med contentful/gatsby och .NET/Azure. Vi har blivit uppmärksammade nationellt för detta arbete, dels med ett silver i Svenska Designpriset 2019 för Kolmården, en nominering i Svenska Designpriset 2020 för Gröna Lund (prisutdelningen har ännu inte skett så vi vet inte var vi landar) samt Kolmården seger i IDG topp-100 för bästa turismsajt.
* Filmstaden - Har du bokat/köpt biobiljett? Kanske inte på sistone men innan året som gud glömde gjorde du antagligen det har du använt vår lösning. Vi ansvarar för all extern webb samt vissa interna delar. Med denna sajt vann vi IDG topp100 2018 (då SF Bio). Webben utvecklas i en episervermiljö med .NET och Azure.


**Vi tror att du har:**
* Ca 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta skarpt som utvecklare. Det är viktigt att du arbetat i enterprise-projekt med webb för många slutanvändare.
* .NET och Azure-kompetens


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Kapacitet att ta tead-roll i våra projekt.
* Kompetens inom Episerver och Contentful-erfarenhet, Xamarin
* Erfarenhet som konsult


**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi är en flexibel arbetsplats som kommer erbjuda distansarbete även när pandemin är över. För dem som vill jobba från kontoret på Sveavägen är det bara att komma in och jobba, dem som föredrar distansarbete kommer jobba primärt hemifrån men vara på kontoret 1-2 dagar i veckan i alla fall av primärt sociala skäl. Vi vill inte bara vara en namnlista på Slack. Utöver den naturliga komptensutvecklingen som sker av att arbeta i team med likasinnade erbjuder vi både externa och interna utbildningar. Vi startar exempelvis ett nytt initiativ vi kallar Kompetensnätverk - Från utvecklare till arkitekt, där en av våra lösningsarkitekter guidar dem som vill mot mer kunskap inom arkitektur för att förbereda dig för en roll som lösningsarkitekt om du så önskar.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på B3 och Rebel and Bird och hur vi arbetar med wellness och våra sociala initiativ här
   

  

 Klicka på ansökan eller tveka inte att kontakta Jocke Ginsburg på telefonnummer: 073-8133010 eller email: jocke@rebelandbird.com

title: Senior Accountant I
description:
**Who we are is what we do.**


Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.


Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 7,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

**Why should you be part of our success story?**


As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.


Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.


Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $17.3 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

**Summary**


Plays a vital role in maintaining financial health by ensuring accurate financial reporting, compliance with regulatory requirements, and the implementation of effective accounting practices. This position supports the monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes and contributes to the development and improvement of financial policies and procedures. Reporting to the Accounting Manager, this role ensures that the company operates within legal guidelines across all locations.

**Responsibilities**

* Take part in the monthly, quarterly, and annual closing process
* Assist with improving, developing, documenting, and implementing accounting and finance related policies and procedures to support the company’s scale
* Manage and comply with government reporting requirements, statutory financial statements and tax filings, sales tax, franchise tax, multiple taxes in the states, etc.
* Support and assist with internal reports and reconciliations
* Ad-hoc projects
* Work with external auditors

**Qualifications**

* Chartered Accountant / CPA with at least 5 years of accounting experience, preferably with audit experience
* Big 4 experience from high tech departments (advantage)
* Well-organized with ability to prioritize and meet tight deadlines in a dynamic environment
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a high level of attention to details
* Proficiency with systems and MS office
* Experience with Netsuite (advantage)
* Team player, strong communication and interpersonal skills

**Total Rewards**


Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

**Some things you’ll enjoy**

* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

*Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @**deel.com* *and other acquired company emails like @**payspace.com* *and @**paygroup.com**. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visiting* *our careers page**.*  

  

*Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.*  

  

*Deel will provide accommodations on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodations, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team* *via this link* *and a team member will be in touch to ensure your equal participation. If you have difficulty accessing the form, please email at recruiting@deel.com.*


We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.


We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.


For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

title: Manager, Account Executive, Mid-Market | Nordics

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. With our momentum—backed by a $17.3 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

**Responsibilities**

* Lead a team of Mid-Market Account Executives focused on acquiring new business for the Nordics region
* Attract, hire, retain high performing talent with an aptitude to learn and grow
* Drive a high performance, high accountability culture to achieve and exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual sales goals
* Coach, manage and develop sellers with an emphasis on continual learning and skill-gap improvement
* Develop processes that scale and drive consistent execution across the team
* Actively monitor sales pipeline, activity & forecasts to proactively adapt to changing conditions

**Requirements**

* 5+ years leading a team of Account Executives with demonstrated success in Mid-Market
* Ability to identify areas of opportunity, recommend solutions, take ownership of implementation and/or project management of sales initiatives
* Demonstrate a deep understanding of the business by sharing insights, the root causes behind changes in KPI's, the frequency and impact of these root causes and your recommendations to double down or course correct as needed
* Analytical Sales Leader with strong experience using data to drive decision making
* Ability to communicate complex information and processes in a streamlined, easy-to-understand fashion
* Excellent written and spoken communication in English
* Native or full proficiency in any of the Nordic languages (Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Danish)

**Total Rewards**


Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

title: Account Executive
description:
Account Executive  



This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.**Who We Are:**


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

**Job Description:**

  



Joining our HPE Hybrid Cloud organisation and working as part of our newly created Cloud Ops team (including OpsRamp, Morpheus and Zerto solutions) is a chance to make history and be a driving force in the industry. We are revolutionizing cloud computing by building a large-scale, enterprise-ready platform that powers a hybrid edge-to-cloud world. Our platform enables the world's largest and most diverse enterprise IT teams and managed service providers to control the chaos of modern digital infrastructure, and to deliver quickly, efficiently, and at scale while keeping their data secure and meeting sustainability goals.


We do this through hybrid discovery and monitoring, event and incident management, remediation, and automation, powered by AI. We help our enterprise and MSP customers avoid costly outages and performance issues that result in lost revenue and productivity.


With over 100,000 dedicated customers and 1 million devices in production, we are committed to accelerating transformation across data, connectivity, cloud, and security, providing essential solutions for businesses of all sizes. Together, we make the impossible possible, and we are confident in our ability to lead the way in shaping the future of cloud computing.

**What you'll do:**

* Understand SaaS selling motion with a successful track record of new account penetration and substantial revenue growth
* Identify and call on senior executives and key stakeholders
* Build strong relationships with the ecosystem of reseller and integration partners
* Responsible for the full lifecycle of sales opportunities
* Collaborate with the assigned field sales teams and Inside sales resources focusing on identifying new business opportunities, account penetration strategies, territory, and pipeline management
* Experienced in working with a BDR to devise a strategy for driving aggressive activity and revenue growth in the territory
* Track customer details in Salesforce - use case, time frames, success criteria, red flags, and forecasting

**What you’ll need:**

* Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience
* At least 5 years of Software sales with a successful track record of penetrating mid and large enterprise consumers
* Ability to develop C-level relationships and articulate complex technologies
* Willingness to travel into the territory for marketing events and sales activities
* IT Operations Management (ITOM) Experience is preferred
* Fluency in English language is required and preferably also in Swedish language

**Additional Skills:**


Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}**What We Can Offer You:**

**Health & Wellbeing**


We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

**Personal & Professional Development**


We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

**Unconditional Inclusion**


We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

**Let's Stay Connected:**


Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.


#sweden
#hybridcloud, #sales**Job:**


Sales**Job Level:**


Master  



HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**

  



HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

  



**No Fees Notice & Recruitment Fraud Disclaimer**

 *It has come to HPE’s attention that there has been an increase in recruitment fraud whereby scammer impersonate HPE or HPE-authorized recruiting agencies and offer fake employment opportunities to candidates. These scammers often seek to obtain personal information or money from candidates.*

Any candidate/individual who relies on the erroneous representations made by fraudulent employment agencies does so at their own risk, and HPE disclaims liability for any damages or claims that may result from any such communication.*

title: Advisory Solution Consultant - Data and AI
description:
**Company Description**  

At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.


With more than 7,400+ customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2021 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies®.


Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.

 **Job Description**  

In this role, you will work in close partnership with Specialist Sales Executives, Account Teams, and Partners to co-design integrated, outcomes-based solutions leveraging the full ServiceNow portfolio. As a Specialist Solution Consultant, you are a trusted technical and business advisor leading the pre-sales experience for ServiceNow’s AI, Data& Analytics solutions. You will engage early with C-suite and senior customer stakeholders to understand their business goals, shape technical strategy, and co-create compelling solution visions. Leveraging your deep platform expertise, you will design and deliver tailored demonstrations, proof-of-concepts, and workshops that showcase our platform’s potential to drive transformative outcomes.


Key Responsibilities

* Build trusted customer relationships and engage early to support shaping AI and Data strategies.
* Lead consultative discovery sessions with C-suite stakeholders to understand business challenges, define requirements, and co-create solution visions that align ServiceNow’s (Agentic) AI, Data & Analytics capabilities with customers’ transformation goals.
* Design innovative, state-of-the-art solution experiences that address specific business challenges and deliver them through impactful storytelling.
* Serve as the technical subject matter expert throughout the sales process, qualifying opportunities, responding to RFPs and RFIs, and providing architectural guidance to ensure solutions are feasible, scalable, and positioned for successful adoption and expansion post-sale.
* Provide thought leadership that showcases ServiceNow innovations, inspiring not only the ServiceNow community but also sales and solution consultant teams.
* Collaborate with broader Solution Consulting teams to build and present reusable yet easily tailored demonstrations, hands-on proof-of-concepts, and “art of the possible” workshops that clearly communicate technical value and business impact, driving customer validation and buy-in.
* Actively drive and support regional knowledge sharing and enablement activities for customers and partners.
* Present at executive briefings, industry events, and partner forums to share ServiceNow’s vision on data, analytics, and AI-driven enterprise transformation.
* Regularly share, document, and scale best practices within the Solution Consulting team.
* Provide essential customer-based product feedback to Product Management for continuous improvement.
* Guide and mentor colleagues, fostering a culture of collaboration and customer obsession.

  

**Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* Demonstrable 5+ years of experience in solution consulting, pre-sales engineering, or technical consultancy focused on enterprise platforms that leverage business data through integration.
* Direct experience in data governance, data lineage, and data quality management, with a strong understanding of best practices, policies, and standards, is preferred.
* Skilled in architectural and value-based discussions on advanced analytics and/or AI, preferably with proficiency in data-driven Agentic AI business solutions.
* Deep understanding of ServiceNow or similar enterprise cloud platforms, data/analytics architectures, GenAI/AI/ML concepts, and the business value of digital transformation in large enterprises.
* Proven ability to engage, influence, and build trust with C-level and senior stakeholders, especially Chief Data Officers, CIOs, Chief AI Officers, and Enterprise Architects.
* Strong business acumen and communication skills to translate technical capabilities into clear business outcomes and value realization.
* Demonstrated track record of supporting or closing significant enterprise solutions deals, including leading workshops, driving hackathons, creating demos/POCs, and pursuing technical validation.
* Excellent cross-functional teamwork, facilitation, and presentation skills.
* Continuous awareness of trends in data, analytics, (Agentic) AI, and digital transformation.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business, or related field experience (advanced degrees preferred but not required).
* Willingness to travel regionally (up to 30–50%) to engage customers, partners, and internal teams.

  

**Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Senior Data Scientist – MLOps & Agentic AI (Production)
description:
January 9, 2026
Hybrid
Sweden
Posted 7 hours ago
We are hiring **Senior Data Scientist – MLOps & Agentic AI (Production)**for the position based in **Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid – 2–3 days onsite per week).**


**Educational Qualification:** Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.


**Job Summary:**



We are seeking a highly experienced **Senior Data Scientist with strong MLOps and Agentic AI expertise**. This is a high-impact, hands-on role focused on shaping, scaling, and operationalizing AI/ML and Generative AI systems in production. The role combines technical leadership and hands-on development, with responsibility for designing AI architectures, building Agentic AI solutions, and leading end-to-end MLOps practices. You will play a key role in building the AI foundation behind company simulations and delivering production-grade ML, LLM, and Agentic systems that directly impact business KPIs.


**Required Experience/Competences:**


* 7–8 years of experience as a **Senior Data Scientist / Applied Scientist / ML Engineer**.
* Strong **software engineering fundamentals** with a focus on clean, maintainable, production-grade code.
* Extensive hands-on experience with **Python**.
* Proven experience designing and implementing **MLOps pipelines** and managing ML systems in production.
* Hands-on experience with **Agentic AI frameworks**, real-time LLM orchestration, and serverless architectures.
* Deep experience working with **LLMs and Generative AI**, including recent advancements (within the last ~6 months).
* Experience building or fine-tuning **open-source ML/LLM models** is a strong plus.
* Experience with **AWS or other cloud platforms** is a strong advantage.
* Strong background in **traditional ML models** applied in large-scale or enterprise environments.


**Soft Skills:**


* Strong technical leadership and ownership mindset.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder collaboration skills.
* Highly proactive, self-driven, and solution-oriented.
* Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Comfortable working in fast-paced, high-impact technical environments.

title: SAP iXp Intern - Sales Management
description:
**We help the world run better**  

At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed. **About the SAP Internship Experience Program**  

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

 **Three reasons to intern at SAP**

* Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
* Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
* Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

 **What you’ll do:**

* Be part of the SAP Corporate Sales team in Stockholm. Assist sales management with partner, sales and event follow-ups for both the Swedish and Norwegian sales organization.
* Help schedule both internal and external sales activities.
* Support sales team with Account Planning and Account Management.
* This role will develop business acumen and business planning to help career development.


Location: Stockholm

 **What you bring:**


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

* University student
* We are looking for a predictable, reliable and structured person that assist and learn during the stay with SAP.
* Language: Swedish and English full professional proficiency

 **Meet your team:**


Both at the Stockholm and Oslo office we are an experienced sales team working with some of the largest companies in the region. Working with this sales team will help you understand business, technology and processes at Europe´s largest software vendor.

 **Bring out your best**  

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
  

  

**We win with inclusion**  

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.  

  

SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.  

  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.  

  

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.  

  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. **AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**
For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.
Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.

title: Vikarierande kommunikatör - digitala medier
description:
Vi är stolta över Trollhättans stads över 5 000 medarbetare, som varje dag gör en positiv skillnad i våra invånares liv och är med och utvecklar stadens hållbarhet och livskraft. Vi drivs och motiveras av ledorden Mod, Delaktighet, Nytänkande och Handlingskraft. Här finns en spännande utveckling där du kan vara med och göra vår stad ännu bättre.

### **Beskrivning**


På kommunikationsavdelningen arbetar vi med att utveckla Trollhättans stads kommunikation med invånare, medarbetare och andra intressenter, så att den är tillgänglig, tydlig och trovärdig. Vi ska göra det enkelt för alla som arbetar i Trollhättans stad att kommunicera med invånare, näringsliv och andra intressenter. Vi vill också bidra till att visa att vi är en attraktiv plats att leva och verka på och en spännande organisation att arbeta i. Kommunikationsavdelningen ansvarar för kommunikationsplattformar och styrdokument, och stödjer verksamheterna med olika kommunikationsinsatser. Vi är ett gott gäng på nio medarbetare med olika kompetenser och roller som hjälper varandra och har roligt ihop. De flesta av oss arbetar som generalister mot en eller flera förvaltningar, medan andra är specialister inom t ex webb, grafisk profil och sociala medier. Då en av våra medarbetare nu ska bli förälder söker vi en vikarie.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**


Ditt primära uppdrag består av tre olika delar, där du har huvudansvaret inom två områden:

* **Grafisk formgivning**  

Du säkrar den röda tråden i vår visuella identitet och ansvara för utvecklingen av vår grafiska profil. Du formger olika typer av grafiskt material för tryck och digital publicering.
* **Sociala medier**  

Du håller ihop vårt arbete inom sociala medier genom omvärldsbevakning, produktion av innehåll, analys och uppföljning, annonsering osv.
* **Foto och rörliga medier**  

Du stöttar också upp med foto, pod och film vid behov, redigerar filmer för olika användningsområden och målgrupper.


I uppdraget ingår också upphandling av tryckeritjänster, profilprodukter och huvudansvaret för system och programvaror inom dina kompetensområden, vilket innebär kontakter med leverantörer och säljare. Du leder utvecklingsprojekt, utbildar och fungerar som kompetensstöd till övriga kommunikatörer. Du kommer också att rycka in och hjälpa till med andra kommunikationsuppgifter vid behov. Du kommer ofta att jobba i team tillsammans med kollegor, där våra olika kompetenser och styrkor kompletterar varandra. Innehållet i uppdraget kan variera över tid och justeras utifrån förändringar på avdelningen.

### **Kvalifikationer**


Du har en högskoleutbildning inom digitala medier eller motsvarande. Du ska ha dokumenterad erfarenhet inom kompetensområdena: filmproduktion, grafisk formgivning och sociala medier.


För att klara ditt uppdrag behöver du:

* Vara vass på grafisk produktion, oavsett om det handlar om trycksaker, infografik, bildbehandling, webb eller sociala medier.
* Ha ett estetiskt öga för kommunikation genom bild och form. Du förstår vad det innebär att arbeta grafiskt inom en sammanhållen grafisk profil, och klarar att vara kreativ inom givna ramar med en tydlig röd tråd i allt material, oavsett kanal.
* Ha erfarenhet av att producera film för olika målgrupper, och ha god kunskap i något av de vanligen förekommande filmredigeringsprogrammen, gärna Premiere Pro.
* Ha kunskap om och erfarenheter av analys och uppföljning av professionellt användande av sociala mediekanaler.
* Vara en mycket erfaren användare av Adobe Creative Cloud och de programvaror som ingår där, exempelvis Photoshop, Premiere Pro, Illustrator och Indesign, eller motsvarande programvaror.
* Ha kunskaper om och förståelse för de lagstiftningar som påverkar vår kommunikation, såsom DOS-lagen och dataskyddsförordningen och kan tillgänglighetsanpassa dokument.


För att fungera i rollen behöver du vara samarbetsinriktad då rollen innebär många kontakter, främst inom Trollhättans Stads många skiftande verksamheter. Då vi är en liten avdelning som behöver hjälpas åt i stora och små uppdrag behöver du vara flexibel och kunna anpassa dig efter förutsättningar som ibland växlar snabbt. Då du kommer att jobba självständigt med flera parallella uppdrag, både operativa och strategiska, är det viktigt att du själv kan skapa en struktur för ditt arbete och hålla uppsatta mål.

### **Anställningsinformation**


Föräldraledighetsvikariat, från ca 2026-05-01 fram till 2027-09-01 med möjlighet till förlängning.  

Tillsättning sker under förutsättning att vikariatet inte behöver tas i anspråk.


Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons! Trollhättan är en stark och attraktiv kommun som ska bli större. I dag är vi ca 59 000 invånare och vi har siktet inställt på att växa till 70 000 trollhättebor. Inom Trollhättans stad arbetar vi med att skapa förutsättningar för detta. Vi är över 5 000 medarbetare och våra 350 olika yrken bidrar på olika sätt med att ge service och underlätta en bra vardag för våra invånare - nu och i framtiden. Vi ser mångfald som en styrka som berikar vår verksamhet och välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund. Trollhättans stad tillämpar rökfri arbetstid.


Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Trollhättan | Län: Västra Götalands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2026/2 | Kontakt: Vivian Komstadius, Kommunikationschef 0733-489969, | Facklig företrädare: Vision 0520-497850, | Publicerat: 2026-01-09 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-02-01

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
**Overview**  

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I **Mechanical Engineer**, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform.


Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 datacenters in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.


With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.


Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

 **Responsibilities**  

* A strong desire and capability to learn, grow, and develop new skills
* Empower a culture of safety, security, and compliance in all aspect of data center activities
* Understand the design and functionality of your datacenter
* Work alongside a team of industry professionals across the Information Technology (IT) and Critical Environments (CE) spectrum to support 24x7x365 on-site datacenter operations and mechanical infrastructures.
* Act as the technical authority for on-site operations of large-scale mechanical systems and designs.
* Collaborate with the Operations and Design team to develop data center (DC) mechanical designs, starting from project conception to issue for construction (IFC) for new DC projects build outs and major infrastructure upgrades.
* Establish and coordinate maintenance & safety procedures, maintaining redundant high-capacity cooling systems; to operating and supporting datacenter backup electrical systems (diesel generators, rotary UPS, etc.)
* Steward vital infrastructure supporting deployments of Microsoft's online services.
* Assist with supplier selection and overseeing mechanical supplier execution.

  

**Qualifications** **Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, or related field AND 3+ months related technical engineering experience or internship experience
	+ OR Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering, or related field
	+ OR equivalent experience.

 **Background Check Requirements:**


Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:

* Microsoft Cloud Background C.heck: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


While not required, we also look for the following **Preferred Qualifications****:**

* 5+ years related technical engineering experience
	+ OR Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, or related field AND 2+ years related technical engineering experience.

  

  

This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.

  

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process**.**

title: Senior Business Controller
description:
At ASICS, we’re more than just a brand; we're a movement. A movement of movement, propelled by the belief that motion strengthens the body and uplifts the mind. Our name itself, an acronym for **"Anima Sana in Corpore Sano" (a Sound Mind in a Sound Body),** encapsulates this commitment. Since taking our first step in Japan in 1949, our journey has been about more than just reaching the finish lines or clocking the fastest times. It's about the joy of moving and it's open to all.  



If you're inspired to move yourself and the world toward a brighter, more inclusive future, we're looking for you.  



Here at ASICS, we welcome diversity in our people, their backgrounds and life experiences. So, you could be the right person for this role regardless of your age, nationality, religious beliefs, or gender identification.  


**Your role in our shared journey**

As **Senior Commercial Business Controller** located at ASICS Nordic Head Office in Gothenburg, you'll contribute to our mission by delivering key insights to drive profitable growth across the organization. You'll play a key role in delivering pricing insights, supporting strategic planning processes, and monitoring end-to-end channel and product category profitability to help ASICS achieve its business objectives.  


  

In the role, you’ll be part of our team of Commercial Business Controllers and report into our **Head of Commercial Business Control.** Your responsibilities will be the **Nordic and Benelux Commercial Region** and you will support and work closely together with our **Sales Director Nordics & Benelux.**  


**Your key responsibilities will be:**

* Review, analyze and report the P&L areas that belong to the role for the actuals, annual financial plans and quarterly forecast, with an action driven mind-set to improve contribution margin
* Contribute, support and influence the short & mid-term strategy and short-term tactics from a category, channel, customer perspective with a focus on contribution margin in the responsible market or subchannels
* Own final financial submissions and provide stakeholders with valuable fact-based and data driven insights for the monthly business review, Annual Financial Planning, Quarterly Forecasts and Seasonal Target Setting.
* Responsible for full P&L Business cases (new initiatives, countries, products, channels)
* Own and continuously improve forecasting, budget processes and financial reporting

  

  

**You have the following skills:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Business Administration or Accountancy
* Minimally 8 years working experience in accounting or controlling teams
* Preferably experience in a FMCG/Sporting goods/Wholesale/Retail environment, Ecommerce is a plus
* Experience in forecasting and budgeting processes and long-term forecasting, preferably in an international business
* Experience with SAP, SAP BI, SAP Analytics Cloud Reporting is a plus
* Strong personal efficiency with high attention for detail
* Pro-active attitude and strong sense of ownership, ability to influence others to gain buy in for ideas/projects
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Effective communication skills, ability to explain Finance topics to non-financials
* Good command of written and spoken English. Knowledge in Swedish/Danish/Norwegian or Finnish is a plus
* Advanced Skills in Microsoft Office applications especially Excel, PowerPoint, Thinkcell

  


**Life at ASICS**  

When you join ASICS, you become part of something special. Here, your voice matters, your growth and wellbeing are important. We believe in fostering an environment where every step forward is celebrated, where diversity fuels our journey, and inclusion strengthens individuals. Together and as individuals we can inspire more people to move for body and for mind.  



We look forward to receiving your application online – just send your CV and motivation letter via our career page.  

  

#ASICScareers

title: Teknisk PL Migrering IFS Cloud - Svenska Spel
description:
Teknisk PL Migrering IFS Cloud - Svenska Spel


Sista ansökningsdag:


2026-01-12

 **Placeringsort:**


Stockholm/Hybrid

**Avtalsperiod:**


2026-01-26 - 11 månader med option på förlängning med 6 mån

**Omfattning:**


80-90% (OBS. 100% innebär 35h/v)

 **Uppdragsbeskrivning:**


Den tekniska projektledaren kommer att ansvara för att leda arbetet för det tekniska teamet i IFS till Cloud-projekt i sin helhet. Det tekniska teamet kommer att bestå av interna såväl som externa tekniska specialister. Ansvarar för att den tekniska miljön, inklusive integrationer, etableras och fungerar i enlighet med hur verksamheten bedriver sitt arbete. Rapporterar till huvudprojektledaren för IFS till Cloud-projektet.
  

  

Leverabler:
  

* Tillsammans med teamet etablera en tydlig plan för etableringen av den tekniska lösningen.
* Projektleda och driva etableringen enligt tidsplan.
* Vid projektets slut överlämna aktuell dokumentation och systemlandskapsbeskrivning.

  

Baserat på agila arbetssätt ska Tekniska projektledaren kunna:
  

* Planera, leda, styra och följa upp det tekniska teamet.
* Arbeta iterativt med vedertagna metoder för konstant förbättring av kvalitet och leverans.
* Ansvara för att uppdraget leveranser följer Svenska Spels processer och riktlinjer.

  

Den Tekniska projektledaren ska kunna demonstrera följande färdigheter:
  

* Strukturerad och ha en väl utvecklad planerings- och koordineringsförmåga
* Pedagogisk och ha en väl utvecklad kommunikativ förmåga.
* Självgående och med god förmåga att arbeta i team
* Förmåga att snabbt sätta sig in i verksamhet och se till helheten i detaljerna
* Lyhörd och god förmåga att situationsanpassa sin kommunikation
* Driva och leda leverans framåt

  

Områden som kommer att beröras, och därmed är bra att ha en god förståelse eller baskunskap kring: • Implementation av standardlösningar
  

* Integrationslösningar, standard eller anpassade
* Säkerhetsgranskningar
* Systemtester
* Acceptanstestmiljöhantering
* Ändrings-, fel- och releasehantering
* Teknisk dokumentation
**Obligatoriska krav:**

* + Minst fem (5) års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Teknisk projektledare eller motsvarande
* + Kunskaper och praktisk erfarenhet inom agila arbetssätt, förvärvade under minst två (2) år
* + Erfarenhet från minst tre (3) uppdrag av att leda ett större team (om ca 8–12 personer) inom liknande uppdrag avseende implementationsprojekt.
* + Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* + Möjlighet att påbörja Uppdraget inom datumintervall 2026-01-26 - 2026-02-13

**Mervärdeskrav:**

* + Erfarenhet av mer än två (2) tidigare uppdrag gällande integrationslösningar i implementationsprojekt (standard och/eller anpassade), med flertalet tredjepartleverantörer
* + Erfarenhet av minst ett (1) uppdrag avseende applikationsdriftsflytt likt det som beskrivs för aktuellt projekt.
* + Erfarenhet från minst ett (1) tidigare uppdrag där man i aktuellt system hanterar känsliga personuppgifter
* + Erfarenhet av implementation av säkra integrationer mellan molnlösningar
* + Erfarenhet av att implementera alternativ integrera mot integrationsplattformar  

**KRAVMATRIS**

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
If you want to ensure that advanced software solutions work seamlessly – from cloud to cab – and see your testing make an impact in real machines, this could be your next step. We’re looking for a Software Test Engineer who brings a strong quality mindset and a genuine interest in how users experience our products in everyday operation.


At CPAC Systems, we believe that different perspectives, backgrounds and experiences are what drive innovation. When you collaborate closely with developers, testers and customers, you help us deliver robust, reliable solutions that truly make a difference.

**About us**
------------


CPAC Systems develops advanced control systems for marine and industrial applications. Since 1999, we’ve been turning complex operations into intuitive experiences. With 250 employees, a portfolio of 80 patents and more than 500,000 delivered products per year, we drive innovation in everything from electrification to intelligent automation, always working at the intersection of safety, efficiency and user experience. As part of Volvo Group, our role is to lead advanced technology development and explore the next generation of smart control systems.

**Your role**
-------------


As a Software Test Engineer you will play a key role throughout the product lifecycle – from early concept to deployment in real-world environments. You will work in a product-driven organization where quality and user experience are central, and where testing is an integrated part of development, not a final checkpoint.


Our team develops in-vehicle Android applications together with cloud services running on Azure. Your responsibility is to ensure smooth integration and reliable operation across these environments. This means testing everything from automated test benches and CI pipelines to machines in operation, such as excavators, wheel loaders and haulers.


You will collaborate closely with both developers and customers, contributing with a strong test perspective that helps shape both features and system behavior.

 **What you will do:**  

  

* Analyze and validate requirements to ensure testability and quality
* Design, implement and maintain test cases for new and existing functionality
* Develop, execute and maintain automated test scripts
* Continuously improve test strategies, tools and processes together with the team
* Contribute to a strong quality culture across development projects
**Key qualifications**
----------------------

* Educational background in software engineering, electronics, or equivalent
* 2-5 years experience with test automation and structured test design
* Proficiency in Python and Pytest
* Experience working with Jenkins or similar CI/CD tools
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken

**It’s a plus if you also bring**
---------------------------------

* Familiarity with Appium for UI and system testing
* Experience with Android-based systems

**Who you are**
---------------


You are passionate about quality and testing, and you naturally put yourself in the end-user’s shoes. You enjoy understanding how complex systems behave in real life and value identifying potential problems early, before they reach the customer. You are comfortable working across disciplines, communicating clearly with developers and stakeholders, and you enjoy taking responsibility.


You are a team player who enjoys close collaboration, while also being comfortable driving your own work forward. You appreciate freedom with responsibility and take ownership of your tasks and deliveries. With a curious mindset and a structured way of working, you help turn advanced technology into reliable, user-friendly solutions.

**How to apply**
----------------


Submit your application as soon as possible, applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. Feel free to reach out to Victoria Sahlberg at victoria.sahlberg@cpacsystems.se if you have any questions regarding the job.

title: Erfaren Enterprise Architect med affärssinne? Vi söker dig!
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens industriella landskap? Vi söker en vass och självgående Enterprise Architecture-rådgivare med ett strategiskt mindset och passion för att skapa verklig affärsnytta i komplexa organisationer. Hos oss får du arbeta med några av Sveriges mest välkända industribolag – i uppdrag där du gör skillnad på riktigt, tillsammans med andra seniora specialister.

**Your future duties and responsibilities**


Som Enterprise Architect hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att driva och förankra arkitektur- och transformationsinitiativ. Vanliga uppgifter inkluderar:  

  

* Ta fram och förankra EA-roadmaps och målbilder
* Rådgivning kring styrning, investeringar och förändringsinitiativ
* Bedömning och design av applikations- och informationslandskap
* Leda EA-forum och stötta beslutsfattare i strategiska teknikval
* Bygga broar mellan IT och verksamhet i transformationsresor
**Required qualifications to be successful in this role**


Vi söker dig som har:  

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet inom IT- eller verksamhetsarkitektur, strategi eller närliggande områden
* Konsulterfarenhet och vana att arbeta nära beslutsfattare
* Förmåga att kommunicera komplexa idéer på ett tydligt och affärsnära sätt
* Kommersiellt mindset och förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer


  

Det är meriterande om du har:  

  

* Erfarenhet från tillverknings- eller byggindustrin
* Kunskap inom ett eller flera av följande områden: Industriell digitalisering / smart industri (Industry 4.0) Produktlivscykelhantering (PLM) & digitala tvillingar Informationsmodellering & datastyrning (data governance) Hållbarhetsrapportering och ESG-drivna IT-initiativ Modernisering av legacy / ERP-landskap i molnmiljöer


  

Viktiga kompetenser och egenskaper:  

  

* Strategisk och analytisk förmåga – du ser helheten och kopplar IT till affärsmål
* Arkitekturkompetens – du behärskar modellering, design och styrning
* Kommunikationsförmåga – du bygger förtroende och leder dialoger med ledning
* Förändringsledning – du har erfarenhet av att driva transformationer
* Teknisk bredd – du har koll på moderna teknologier, molnplattformar och integration


  

Meriterande certifieringar är:  

  

* TOGAF®, ArchiMate®
* Certified Business Architect (CBA®)
* SAFe® Architect / Agilist, ICP-ENT
* AWS / Azure / Google Cloud Architect
* CDMP, COBIT®


  

Vad vi erbjuder:  

  

* Möjlighet att påverka Sveriges mest spännande industriprojekt
* Kollegor som är lika kunniga som de är prestigelösa
* Flexibla arbetsformer och fokus på balans i livet
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och kunskapsdelning

  

Några av våra förmåner är bland annat  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.

  

Låter det intressant?  

Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna Azra Dajic på azra.dajic@cgi.com. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!  

  

#LI-JA1**Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.**  

  

La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…
  

  

Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.  

  

Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.
  

  

Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.  

  

Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

#LI-JA1**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**  

  

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…  

  

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.  

  

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.  

  

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
  

  

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Head of Communications BCSS
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About the opportunity**  

Are you a visionary communications leader with a passion for impactful storytelling, executive engagement, and driving business transformation across global markets? Ericsson is seeking a dynamic Head of Communications to lead and elevate our communications strategy for both our Business Area Cloud Software and Services (BCSS) and Global Service Centres (GSCs) across China, India, Mexico and Romania.  

As Head of Communications, you will lead a high-performing team responsible for executive communications, media relations, strategic narrative development, external positioning, and internal communications.

 **What you will do**  

* Act as a trusted senior communications advisor to BCSS Leadership Team, including the Head of BCSS, and source of thought leadership, crafting compelling narratives and delivering world-class executive communications.
* Define and deploy BCSS strategic narrative to position us as an industry leader in cutting edge Software and Services, translate technical and commercial priorities into clear, audience-specific messages for internal and external audiences.
* Drive external communication, expanding Ericsson’s presence in both traditional and non-traditional media, and working in close collaboration with Group Communication, supporting policy, regulatory, and government advocacy efforts.
* Oversee internal communications programs, strategy communication, all-employee meetings, leadership messaging, and change communication to enable business and culture transformation and employee engagement internally.
* Lead a high-performing, cross-disciplinary team responsible for executive visibility, strategic narrative development, external and employee communications.
* Mentor and grow communications talent, manage budgets and agency relationships, and ensure agile delivery and governance across regions and corporate stakeholders.
* You will work on a strategic level, but you are equally comfortable to work hands on with the organization.
 **You will bring**  

* 12+ years of progressive communications experience, including at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
* Proven expertise in enterprise B2B, telecoms, or technology sector communications.
* Strong track record in executive communications, reputation management, global media/analyst relations.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams and working closely with C-suite stakeholders in a fast-paced matrix organization.
* Exceptional writing, storytelling, and messaging skills, with the ability to translate complex topics into clear business narratives.
* Executive presence and strong collaboration skills.
* Capabilities to think new, pushing boundaries, utilizing the advantages of digitalization and using innovative communication tools.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with tight deadlines
* Bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, business, or a related field; advanced degrees or strategic communications certifications are a plus
**Application**


We look forward to your application with CV in English. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond to applications sent via e-mail. We target 60% work-from-the office.


Last day to apply: 19th January 2026


If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Hiring Manager Cecilia Atterwall, Head of Group Marketing and BCSS M&C at cecilia.atterwall@ericsson.com or Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com


Location: Stockholm, Sweden

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
