title: TechOps Data and Process Excellence lead
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The TechOps Data and Process Excellence lead drives operational excellence and digital transformation across Sobi’s Technical Operations. The role ensures optimized and robust work processes, effective use of digital tools and systems, and reliable performance analysis. By leading cross-functional collaboration, the role enables TechOps to achieve its long-term ambition of delivering cost-efficient, compliant, and sustainable products to patients.
   

  

 This position is based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden or Global hub in Basel, Switzerland, reporting directly to VP Head of Tech Ops Product and Program management.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and deliver the TechOps Operational Excellence and Digitalization roadmap.
* Drive and develop a network of Operational Excellence and Digitalization champions across TechOps through education and coaching.
* Lead the improvement of TechOps process landscape, systems, and tools by Identifying, evaluating (benefit vs. cost/effort) and track cross functional improvement opportunities; project manage where appropriate.
* Embed the Global Business Process Ownership structure; act as Process Owner where required
* Develop the TechOps organization with regards to data utilization and digital innovation
* Partner with the TO leadership team to evaluate, design, and execute strategic improvement initiatives. Analyze data, visualize organizational performance, and support senior stakeholder communication.
* Promote a strong culture of continuous improvement by leading root cause analyses, learning reviews, and global knowledge sharing.
* Ensure efficient training programs across TechOps.


**Qualifications**
**About you**
 You are an experienced leader in the pharmaceutical industry who thrives on driving transformation and building collaborative ways of working. You combine a strong foundation in operational excellence with a passion for digitalization and data-driven decision-making. You are comfortable working in a matrixed environment, influencing senior stakeholders, and developing teams and leaders across functions. You are ambitious, strategic, and analytical, with a genuine interest in people and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* University degree in manufacturing, supply chain, or equivalent experience.
* Minimum 10 years of pharmaceutical industry experience, including organizational development.
* Proven expertise in Operational Excellence methodologies (Lean, Six Sigma, or similar) in a virtual setting.
* Experience in digital tool and system optimization, including AI application.
* Strong capability in data analysis, performance visualization, and business reporting.
* Demonstrated success in collaborative leadership, team development, and cross-functional influence.
* Excellent strategic planning, operational, and analytical skills.
* Strong business drive with solid influencing and negotiation abilities.
* Ability to work independently, take initiative, and drive results.
* Proven ability to motivate and collaborate across functional areas, including at Executive Committee level.
* Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills (written, oral, listening).
* Fluent in English.


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**How to apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 We are a global company with over 1,900 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: IT Security Officer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*
***In Brief***
*At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery, we are building the next generation investment platform.*
**This is part of the role**
 Nordnet is a company with tech as its primary focus, currently rebuilding its entire platform in the cloud to enhance innovation and scalability. As a member of our security team, you will ensure that security is an integrated part of our infrastructure and operations. You will embrace our guiding principles of automation and simplicity, reducing repetitive tasks through orchestration to allow more time for proactive threat hunting and continuous improvement.
   

  

 As an IT Security Officer, your main responsibilities are related to detection engineering, monitoring, and automation, such as:
   

  

* Detection Engineering: Design, develop, and maintain advanced detection rules within our SIEM to identify sophisticated cyber threats and anomalous behavior across cloud and on-premise environments.
* SOAR & Automation: Drive the automation of repetitive security tasks and incident response workflows to reduce Mean Time to Respond (MTTR), integrating our security tools into a cohesive response fabric.
* Continuous Monitoring & Log Governance: Drive the continuous security monitoring of Nordnet’s IT infrastructure by ensuring high-quality log ingestion and the integrity of audit trails. You will be responsible for maintaining the health of log sources and ensuring that security-critical events are correctly aggregated and analyzed to protect Nordnet’s digital assets.
* Incident Response: Serve as a technical lead during security incidents, utilizing SIEM data to conduct forensic analysis and root-cause investigations.


 The security team is a central function for all Nordic countries that the bank operates in, and you will be reporting to the Head of Security at Nordnet.
   

  

 As part of our commitment, members of the Security team participate in a rotating on-call schedule. The on-call responsibility is to be the initial point of contact in the event of a critical security incident.
   

  

**This is you**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you take great pride in your work, are curious and continuously want to learn and grow. Believing in collaboration and discussing ideas and concepts with your colleague, you will serve as the first point of contact for our IT Operation organisation.
   

  

**What You’ll Bring To The Team**
* Extensive experience managing enterprise SIEM platforms, specifically in writing complex queries and tuning detection logic.
* Proven experience in automation/scripting to build SOAR playbooks and streamline security operations.
* Strong understanding of log source management, including Windows Event Logs, Linux Syslog, Application logs and Cloud-native logging from GCP.


 We also require that you speak and write English fluently, Swedish is not mandatory but an advantage.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as a security professional
* Competitive salary and compensation


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. Our teams are autonomous and embrace the agile way of working.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees located in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki, Copenhagen and Frankfurt.
   

  

 Visit us on: career.nordnetab.com/pages/engineering
   

  

 Learn more about Nordnet in our brand movie This is Nordnet, that describes our identity.
   

  

**Questions & Applications**
 Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. As the Christmas Holidays are approaching, please note that selection and interviews will begin mid January.
   

  

 If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Lovisa Malmberg at lovisa.malmberg@nordnet.com
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: CloudOps Engineer till vår kund i Stockholm
description:
Du får en nyckelroll i att driva och utveckla hybrid cloud-miljöer. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar paketering och deployment av appar i Intune, integrationer och automation i Azure, samt arbete med nätverk och säkerhet. Du blir en viktig del av teamet och har stor möjlighet att påverka teknikval och arbetssätt.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantera och utveckla cloudlösningar, främst i Azure och Intune.
* Paketering och deployment av appar i Intune.
* Automatisera och förbättra processer med CI/CD pipelines.
* Arbeta med nätverk, säkerhet och integrationer i molnet.
* Delta i incident-, problem- och förändringshantering.
* Samarbeta med kollegor och bidra till en trygg och effektiv IT-miljö.


**Vem vi söker?**
 Du är självgående men trivs i grupp, har ett öga för säkerhet och erfarenhet av logic apps och cloudlösningar. Du har en bred förståelse för molnteknik och har arbetat med integrationer och deployment i Azure. Du ser helheten och har ett mindset för att driva utveckling framåt.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Flera års erfarenhet av cloudmiljöer, gärna Azure och Intune.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD pipelines och integrationer.
* God förståelse för nätverk och säkerhet.
* Vana av paketering och deployment av appar.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Logic Apps är meriterande.
* Du kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska och svenska.


**Övrigt**
* Start: efter överenskommelse.
* Uppdragsform: Konsultuppdrag, med möjligt övertag till kund i framtiden.


 PASSAR VI DIG?
   

  

 Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT. Vår uppgift är att hitta rätt person till rätt IT-jobb, genom rekrytering och konsulter. Vi tror på människan i en framtida teknikutveckling och brinner för att bygga relationer, inkludera fler i IT-branschen och naturligtvis matcha rätt kompetens till rätt uppdrag. Vi vill vara en självklar go-to career partner oavsett om kandidaten söker jobb i dagsläget eller inte. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Läs mer om oss, vår kultur och våra värderingar på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 ANSÖKAN
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Johan Karlsson (Johan.Karlsson@wiseit.se). Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.

title: Sr Cloud Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
**Job Description:**
 Are you inspired by the idea of delivering a smooth gaming experience to 260 million players? Join the Cloud Platform Team! We are responsible for developing and maintaining the GKE Platform for all games at King. In our team, we focus on reliability, performance and scalability–our platform supports an average traffic of millions of requests per second from all our beloved games. We work closely with King’s teams to support game feature development, handle intense traffic events and highly concurrent data storage. In our daily work, we promote creativity and innovation by adopting the latest technologies and constantly improving and evolving our platform.
   

  

 Shared Tech is the engine that powers all our live games. With the aim of providing the best possible experience for our developers and creators, as well as our hundreds of millions of players, our extensive team is integral to deliver King’s mission of Making the World Playful. Dedicated to keeping our talented game makers productive, we enable the Kingdom to create, build, launch and operate every King game, across a vast number of platforms and mobile devices. We are the stage where King games love to perform!
   

  

 Your role within the Kingdom
   

  

* You’ll partner closely with game and platform teams to deploy games/services on our GKE platform via self-service capabilities, standard patterns, and guardrails that accelerate delivery while maintaining reliability and security
* Manage and optimize GKE clusters for high reliability, scalability, and efficiency
* Automate infrastructure provisioning with Terraform and Crossplane for repeatable deployments
* Design scalable systems for 260+ million players, ensuring performance and availability
* Oversee cloud networking (Shared VPC, Cloud Armor, Firewalls, BGP/peering, IPv6, Kubernetes networking, Cloud Router/Interconnect, VPN)
* Manage Istio service mesh, Google Cloud load balancing, and large-scale networks to support millions of requests/sec
* Manage cloud services (Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Secret Manager, Workload Identity, Spanner) for game teams
* Build/extend compute platforms and automation tools to streamline game backend operations
* Automate CI/CD with CloudBuild, Jenkins, Atlantis, ArgoCD for seamless deployments
* Implement security-first infrastructure to ensure stability and compliance
* Troubleshoot and resolve incidents to improve resilience and scalability
* Support the full game backend lifecycle, from initial deployment to high-traffic live operations
* Mentor engineers, lead critical projects, and foster an open, fun, and innovative culture


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

* Cloud Networking: Expertise in BGP/peering, IPv6, Kubernetes networking, Cloud Router/Interconnect, VPN, NAT, BeyondCorp, IAP
* Kubernetes & Cloud: Hands-on GKE management, cluster optimization, scaling, and troubleshooting
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Expertise with Terraform and Crossplane for automating cloud infrastructure
* CI/CD & GitOps: Proficiency with Cloud Build, CloudBees CDRO, Jenkins, Atlantis, ArgoCD for automated deployments
* Monitoring & Observability: Experience with OTel, Grafana, Prometheus for full-stack visibility
* Cloud Resource Management: Experience managing Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Secret Manager, Workload Identity
* Security & Governance: Deep understanding of cloud security, IAM, zero-trust networking, and secrets management
* Scalability & Resilience: Ability to design highly scalable, resilient game infrastructure with automation
* Troubleshooting & Reliability: Expertise in debugging distributed systems, finding root causes, and enhancing reliability
* Leadership & Collaboration: Excellent communication, mentoring, and cross-functional collaboration skills
* Passion for Gaming & Innovation: Eager to leverage cutting-edge cloud technology for gaming


**Our Award-winning Culture And Sweet Benefits**
 What makes King a great place to work is our playful culture, work-life balance and a growth mindset focused on learning every day. And don’t just take our word for it – we’ve featured in both Newsweek’s Most Loved Workplaces and the Sunday Times Best Places to Work.
   

  

 Our sweet benefits and perks support you to get your best work done and have fun along the way. These include:
   

  

* Hybrid working: A Team First, Hybrid Working model that provides working patterns based on the needs of the team – allowing time for connection, collaboration, and celebration, and helping Kingsters balance their personal and work lives.
* Coverage for the important life stuff: The specifics vary location to location, but benefits may include private medical, dental, critical illness, and pension plans.
* Generous holiday allowance: With additional close-down time off between 25th December and the New Year.
* Inspiring workspaces: Next level offices which provide numerous creative spaces as well as free breakfast, snacks, and drinks.
* Plentiful learning opportunities: Access to our dedicated learning platform, LEAP, plus other development programmes and leadership coaching.
* Employee networks: Four employee-led diversity-focused networks and other community groups that raise awareness and help to make the Kingdom even more inclusive.
* Wellbeing offerings: Reimbursements for both physical and mental health related activities, and access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) and mental wellbeing platforms AbleTo and Total Brain. Some offices also have their own onsite gyms.
* Free merch: Through our very own Royal Store, where you can get your hands on some exclusive goodies.
* Other perks: Far more than we can list here, but we also offer an annual Community Day for you to help a good cause, charity donation matching, free and discounted Activision Blizzard games, and our Royal Recognition Awards that reward the commitment of long-serving Kingsters.


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Cloud & AI Specialist Sales Manager
description:
**Overview**
 Are you passionate about leading AI and cloud transformation, driving customer success through deep technical expertise?
   

  

 Join our dynamic Azure team as we lead the charge in AI transformation! As trusted advisors and subject matter experts, we help customers modernize their infrastructure, optimize operations, and drive innovation with Azure's cutting-edge AI capabilities. Whether it's migrating and modernizing estates to be AI-ready, accelerating innovation with AI agents and platforms, empowering development teams with AI, or unifying and modernizing data estates, we help customers build technology solutions to achieve their business needs.
   

  

 The Specialist Sales Manager for Cloud & AI Platforms builds, develops and lead teams of Cloud & AI Specialists to identify and win over the decision makers in the Business and IT department of our Enterprise Customers. You and your team will drive decisions for the customer that will help them achieve Business value with the Microsoft Azure Platform, and thereby secure long-term sustainable growth for Microsoft. As a Specialist Sales Manager, you will be a key leader in helping customers embrace and succeed through Cloud & AI transformation. You will have proven experience developing a high-performance team through continuous coaching, and inspiration and excel at developing strong relationships and leadership connections to understand customer needs and partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs. You will lead Cloud &AI Platform Specialists to build and maintain strong, accurate pipeline, sales orchestration across the Enterprise Operating Unit for the teams’ territories, and drive rigor in program utilization to accelerate deals and reduce time to deployment.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Cloud & AI Specialist Sales Manager you will lead a Cloud &AI Platforms Specialist team, that acts as trusted advisors and subject matter experts in Azure. You will work with customers to realize their Cloud & AI transformation journey through cloud computing. We also support customers in evaluating their applications and business requirements, recommend solutions that meet their requirements, and demonstrate these solutions to their decision.
   

  

* Team Coaching: Lead Cloud & AI Platforms Specialists to build and maintain strong, accurate pipeline and drive the Azure business to overachieve revenue, consumption, and scorecard targets. Apply ‘Model, Coach, and Care’ framework through a consistent coaching rhythm.
* Customer Focus:. Dedicate each week to cultivating relationships with Business and IT leaders, business decision-makers, developers. Gain insights into their needs, broaden your network via social media, and seek out new opportunities.
* Stakeholder Management: Foster and sustain effective support from key stakeholders, both within and outside the organization. Remove barriers & orchestrate resources to facilitate smooth execution & progress of engagements.
* Pipeline Management: Use tools and processes to turn leads into opportunities. Update your progress weekly, target customers accurately to convert pipeline.
* Partner Management: Establish a consistent cadence with prioritized partners, emphasizing collaboration, go-to-market strategies, accountability, and achieving ambitious goals. Guide your team to maintain regular interactions and strengthen relationships with partners to accelerate Infra, Data, AI, and Apps initiatives.
* Continuous Learning: Build a learning culture in your team to stay updated on new technologies, partner solutions, industry trends, and competitors.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience in technology‑related sales or account management, with a strong track record of driving cloud, AI, or digital transformation engagements.
* Background in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, Business Administration, Data/Analytics, or a related field (Bachelor’s or Master’s degree preferred, or equivalent practical experience).
* Demonstrated success in solution or services sales, with the ability to manage complex customer scenarios and influence senior technical and business decision makers.
* Strong technical sales leadership experience, particularly in driving cloud services growth, adoption, and consumption across enterprise customers.
* Experienced people leader with a history of developing high‑performing sales and technical specialist teams, providing effective coaching, and leading through influence in large or matrixed organizations.
* Ability to build deep relationships, collaborate across diverse stakeholders, and leverage partner ecosystems to design and deliver customer‑centric cloud and AI solutions.
* Swedish and English Fluency.


 This position will be open for a minimum of 5 days, with applications accepted on an ongoing basis until the position is filled.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance with religious accommodations and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about
 **requesting accommodations.**

title: AI/ML Engineer
description:
***Redpill Linpro är ett företag med djupa rötter inom Open Source och arbetar med de senaste tekniska lösningarna inom våra kärnområden DevOps, API & Integration, Analytics och Cloud. Vi har några av Nordens tyngsta experter inom Azure, AWS, Apache Kafka, Linux, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, för att nämna några exempel. Vi arbetar med åtaganden och utvecklingsprojekt i många olika branscher i Sverige, Norge och Danmark.***
 Vi letar nu efter en AI/ML Engineer till vår Data & Analytics-enhet. I de här rollen kommer du att spela en central roll i att fortsätta utveckla vårt erbjudande. Du kommer att arbeta med kunder som redan kommit en bit på sin resa mot att bli datadrivna och hjälpa dem att utveckla moderna lösningar med hjälp av de senaste teknikerna inom AI och Analytics. Som AI/ML Engineer förstår du att grunden i varje sådan satsning är en säker tillgång till relevant data och det är din roll som konsult att hjälpa våra kunder på den resan. Du måste därför njuta av att både vara hands-on, använda en whiteboard och utmana kunderna, dig själv och det team du arbetar i.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som har erfarenhet av följande:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som AI/ML Engineer eller motsvarande
* Relevant akademisk utbildning
* Kunskap om maskininlärningsmodeller och generativ AI
* Erfarenhet av Databricks, Spark och Kafka
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i Python samt SQL
* Erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg som Power BI, Qlik eller Tableau
* Erfarenhet av uppsättning av cloud-infrastruktur i AWS, GCP eller Azure
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code, med verktyg som t ex Terraform
* Erfarenhet av automatiserade releaseprocesser, DevOps och CI / CD
* Erfarenhet av datamodellering (strukturerad och ostrukturerad data)
* Erfarenhet av agil utveckling
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen
* Flytande i svenska och engelska


 Vill du vara med på resan? Sök tjänsten nu – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Data Engineer in Solution Team
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your role
   

  

 Join our Solution Team to build secure, scalable data platforms and integrations for mission-critical Defence use cases. You will design and operate data flows that connect operational systems with analytics and AI, enabling fast, reliable decisions.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Design, build, and run robust batch and streaming data pipelines across cloud and on‑prem environments
* Develop integrations and APIs: REST, SOAP, JSON, XML, and event‑driven solutions
* Implement authentication and federated identity: OIDC, OAuth, SAML, Kerberos
* Engineer for security by default: certificate management, secrets handling, and end‑to‑end encryption
* Shape platform architecture: reverse proxy patterns, load balancing, VMs, and Kubernetes-based deployments
* Model and optimize datasets in SQL Server, PostgreSQL (or similar), and data lakes
* Develop ETL/ELT with Apache Spark and Databricks (or equivalent)
* Enable BI & Analytics with Qlik, partnering with analysts and domain experts
* Support AI use cases (LLM, object detection, text analytics) with reliable data foundations
* Apply CI/CD, Git, and DevOps practices for high-quality, repeatable delivery
* Monitor, observe, and continuously improve data services for performance, cost, and resilience
* Collaborate closely with product, platform, security, and stakeholder teams to deliver clear outcomes


 Your profile
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual who is outcome-oriented, collaborative, product-minded and autonomous. You are motivated and committed to build dependable solutions in the Defence domain.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

* 3–5 years of experience as a Data Engineer (or similar), delivering production data solutions
* BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent experience
* Proficient in Python and SQL
* Security mindset: certificate management and end to end encryption
* Datastores: SQL Server, PostgreSQL (or similar), and data lakes
* ETL/ELT: Apache Spark, Databricks (or equivalent)
* Cloud: Azure, AWS, or GCP (experience with services like Databricks, BigQuery is preferred)


 Meritorious if you also have:
   

  

* Strong integration background: REST, SOAP, JSON, XML; event driven architectures
* Experienced with CI/CD, Git, and DevOps environments
* JavaScript, Bash, and PowerShell
* Hands on with identity and access: OIDC, OAuth, SAML, Kerberos
* Platform skills: reverse proxies, load balancing, VMs, and Kubernetes
* AI awareness: familiarity with LLMs, object detection, and text analytics


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Why join us? At our company, you will own high-impact solutions that support service members, partners, and critical national infrastructure, making a real difference through your work. You will lead meaningful projects within a modern Digital Solutions organisation that enjoys strong executive sponsorship, providing ample opportunities for growth. We offer a flexible hybrid work model to ensure a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
   

  

 How to apply: Submit your CV along with a brief note highlighting a case you worked on, including the business problem you addressed and the outcomes achieved.
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*

title: Intregrationsspecialist till Sweco!
description:
*Är du en integrationsspecialist med några års erfarenhet som vill ta nästa steg i karriären? Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får samarbeta med många olika delar av verksamheten? Då kan rollen som Integrationsspecialist hos Sweco vara perfekt för dig!*
**Din Vardag**
 Som Integrationsspecialist på Sweco IT blir du en del av teamet Masterdata & Integration inom IT Operations – ett agilt team på 8 personer som stöttar hela organisationen med data och integrationer till olika system och applikationer. Teamet arbetar i tvåveckorssprintar och har regelbundna mötesforum som dagliga standups, sprintplanering, retrospektiv och kunskapsdelning. Du kommer främst att underhålla och vidareutveckla integrationer mellan Swecos datalager och andra externa applikationer, såsom ekonomisystem och HR-system i olika länder. En vanlig dag importeras cirka 400 miljoner rader till datalagret.
   

  

 Som Integrationsspecialist arbetar du med integrationer som är både filbaserade och databas-till-databas, och får lära dig Swecos objektmodell och datalagerstruktur. Du samarbetar med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå krav och leverera innovativa lösningar, och deltar i projekt som löper över både kortare och längre perioder med olika delar av Sweco IT samt övriga verksamheten.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen som Integrationsspecialist tror vi att du har:
   

  

* 3–5 års erfarenhet av integrationer mellan system
* Avancerad kunskap om MS SQL och erfarenhet av MS SQL-databaser
* Erfarenhet av SSIS/ADF och Visual Studio
* Erfarenhet av DevOps är meriterande
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av C#/.NET och Azure-plattformen


 Som person är du social, kommunikativ och gillar att samarbeta med olika parter. Du har ett starkt logiskt tänkande, är lösningsorienterad och strukturerad. Vidare är du proaktiv och tar initiativ i din roll, och har en vilja att ständigt utvecklas och dela kunskap med ditt team.
   

  

**Hur du ansöker**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Sweco med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Gustaf Linder, gustaf.linder@wiseit.se. Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Processen kommer att starta i januari.
   

  

***Passar vi dig?***
 Transforming society together, we’re planning and designing sustainable communities and cities of the future. Sweco erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med stor flexibilitet, möjlighet till hybridarbete och en inkluderande företagskultur. Du får tillgång till förmånsportal, friskvårdsbidrag, bonusprogram och kollektivavtal. Teamet präglas av en familjär känsla och ett öppet klimat där social kompetens värderas högt.

title: Senior Product Manager – Content & Catalog Management
description:
We are seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead one of the strategic areas within the Content and Catalog Management team at Spotify.
   

  

 Our team builds the products that manage the Spotify content catalog. We ensure that users are kept safe from harmful content, uphold copyright and enable easy catalog management with powerful AI capabilities. As a crucial piece of this broader mission, you will work on expanding and iterating on our AI and agent strategy and engage at a cross-mission and company level on one of our core customer groups.
   

  

 You’ll be working on products that improve the lives of hundreds of millions of users daily and impact the creator community who publish their content on Spotify. This is a highly collaborative role, working with teams from across the organization to ensure these experiences serve the needs of users, creators & Spotify.
   

  

 You’ll partner with a cross-disciplinary set of folks across the globe, working in a fast-paced environment, and hopefully have a lot of fun along the way.
   

  

 What You'll do
   

  

* Define and drive a product vision and strategy for AI-powered workflows, aligning your team and stakeholders around a clear direction.
* Prioritize and maintain a long-term roadmap that balances innovation, technical debt, and operational stability.
* Partner with other product areas and strategic initiatives to ensure your team’s work delivers user value and supports Spotify’s broader goals.
* Collaborate with engineering, design, and insights teams to bring ideas from concept to launch, iterating based on data and feedback.
* Use your understanding of AI/ML development to guide product decisions and unlock efficiencies in catalog operations.
* Build alignment and foster strong relationships across teams, ensuring your products are well integrated into the wider Spotify ecosystem.


 Who You Are
   

  

* An experienced Product Manager with a track record of building and launching successful Generative AI or ML products, ideally in an operations or CRM context.
* Skilled at crafting product visions and strategies for complex, multi-stakeholder systems spanning internal tools, consumer experiences, and B2B interfaces.
* Confident in navigating ambiguity and balancing competing priorities, from innovation to maintenance.
* Comfortable using research, analysis, and A/B testing to inform decisions.
* A clear communicator and storyteller, able to tailor your message for different audiences and influence decision-making with empathy.
* Collaborative and hands-on, with high standards for yourself and others. You’re as comfortable setting strategy as you are rolling up your sleeves to tackle details.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London or Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Account Executive
description:
**Join Our Scaleup Journey & Fuel Your Curiosity!**
 At Lime Go, a thriving scaleup under Lime Technologies Sweden AB (publ), you’ll be part of a fast-moving, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a successful, publicly listed company. It's the best of both worlds – the agility of a startup and the stability of an industry leader with a proven track record of success.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
* A curiosity-driven, growth-oriented mindset ready to scale with us
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
* Sharp problem-solving abilities


**Your Role in Our Team**
* Own the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing and handover
* Target ideal customers across industries and regions
* Get creative with omnichannel outreach and inbound leads to build your pipeline
* Tailor our Data-driven Sales CRM to fit each customer’s needs – demo both online and in-person
* Negotiate to win larger deals faster, smashing your sales goals in the process


**The Product**
 Lime Go is a Data-Enriched Sales CRM built for SMBs in the Nordics. You’ll be selling to sales teams who understand the value of what we offer. With over 1,000 customers in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark, our aim is to become the top choice for ambitious companies across Europe.
   

  

 We’ve just completed a full product revamp, making Lime Go a fresh, modern, and powerful tool for your customers.
   

  

**The Lime Go Team**
 We’re a close-knit, ambitious team of 24 with bold growth goals for the coming years. We’re looking for a cornerstone player like you to help make it happen.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements** 
**Requirements**
* B2B sales experience, preferably 2+ years of selling complex products/services (bonus if SaaS!)
* Bachelor’s degree
* Driver's license
* Willing to work from our office in Stockholm
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* A proven track record of sales excellence


 You’ll report to Jonas (Sales Manager) and have weekly 1-on-1s, plus collaborate with our 11-member Revenue Operations team (Sales, CS, Product - all in Stockholm!).
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive base salary with performance-based commissions (with kicker levels!)
* 6 weeks of vacation, company conferences and parties, wellness allowance, pension, and more
* A fun, collaborative environment with regular team activities and laughs


**The Application Process**
* Screening call with the team
* Interview
* Case assignment to pitch our product
* In-depth interview(s) with team members
* Reference check
* Agreement walkthrough
* Final interview with Lime Group’s CEO CEO and/or Business Unit Director.


 Don’t wait – apply now and start your journey with us. Europe is ready for Lime Go. Are you?
   

  

 Let’s Go! 🚀

title: Data Engineer Insight
description:
**Data Engineer**
**Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?**
 Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.
   

  

**Do you want to be our next ”Data Ninja”?**
 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
* Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
* Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
* Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
* Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
* You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.


**Based on our criteria för the role, we expect you to have:**
* Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
* Minimum 2 years experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
* Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
* In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
* Experience in information and dimensional modelling
* Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
* Speaks English and Swedish fluently


**Meritorious** 
**experience:**
* Platform modernisation
* Tabular cubes and DAX
* Data Vault modelling
* Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure

title: Data Analyst (Maternity Cover - 1 year contract)
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 At Sinch, our focus is on driving growth through organic initiatives. Strong organic growth requires a solid data foundation to guide business strategy and build operational efficiency. As part of our Data Analytics department, you'll collaborate with colleagues across multiple regions and functions.
 



 The team's mission is to deliver timely, high-quality insights that support decision-making across the Sinch business, from operational optimisation to tactical and strategic recommendations. To succeed in this role, we're looking for someone who is curious about the drivers behind data patterns, detail-oriented in their execution, and comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-changing environment. You will work closely with multifunctional teams such as Product, Finance, HR, and Sales, and be part of a modern analytics setup using tools like Snowflake, dbt, and Tableau.
 



 This is a one-year fixed-term contract, covering colleagues on parental leave. The role is designed to ensure continuity in analytics delivery and stakeholder support during this period.
 



**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:** 



* Insights and Reporting: Deliver actionable insights through data analysis; maintain and develop dashboards, reports, and models to track key performance indicators and support business decisions.
* Data Model Development: Create and refine models to support our stakeholders' decision-making processes.
* Collaboration and Integration: Work closely with teams such as Product, Finance, and Data Delivery to embed analytics into ongoing business processes and initiatives.
* Continuous Improvement: Assess internal resources, documentation, data sources, and reporting continually, striving for improved quality and accuracy.
* Spreading Data Culture: Support stakeholders in understanding and using data effectively, contributing to a stronger data-driven culture across the organization.
* Analytics Support and Operations: Act as a key point of contact for internal analytics users by managing support requests, investigating data quality or reporting issues, and answering questions related to dashboards and data usage.







**REQUIREMENTS** 



* Experience in business, financial, or strategic analysis, gained through roles such as analytics, finance, modelling, consulting, audit, or similar.
* At least 2 years of experience using Tableau.
* At least 2 years of experience working with SQL, or a comparable track record in analyzing large structured and unstructured datasets.
* A bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative or business-related field (e.g. finance, economics, mathematics, engineering, computer science) is desirable.
* Experience working with stakeholders to solve business problems using data and analytics, including translating insights into clear recommendations.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.



**Big Plus** 



* Experience working in a global company with colleagues and partners across the world.
* Tech, SaaS, or Telecom experience working in a Business-to-business setting.



**Preferred Qualities** 



* Growth Mindset: Encourages continuous learning and development, both personally and professionally, and views challenges as opportunities for growth.
* Detail-Oriented: Pays meticulous attention to the nuances of data and analytics, ensuring accuracy and precision in all aspects of work.
* Adaptability: Demonstrates flexibility in responding to changes in the business environment, maintaining effectiveness in varying situations.
* Emotional Intelligence: Approaches collaboration with empathy and professionalism, building positive and effective working relationships.
* Innovative Mindset: Encourages thinking outside the box and embracing new ideas and technologies, keeping us at the forefront of industry advancements.
* Effective Communication: Exhibits strong skills in expressing ideas and complex data insights clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.



 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English** 
 .
 



 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation outside the EU at this time. Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.







**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Java Developer – E-commerce Platform** 




  





 A well-established Swedish product company within large-scale B2B e-commerce is looking to strengthen its backend team with an experienced
 **Senior Java Developer** 
 . The company operates a
 **high-traffic, business-critical e-commerce platform** 
 used daily by thousands of customers across Sweden.
 



  





 You’ll join a mature, cross-functional product team working close to the business, where quality, scalability and long-term technical decisions really matter.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 



* Designing, building and maintaining backend services for a large-scale e-commerce platform
* Developing robust Java-based solutions in a complex, transaction-heavy environment
* Working closely with product owners, architects, frontend developers and DevOps engineers
* Integrating external systems, APIs and third-party services
* Contributing to architectural discussions and technical improvements
* Taking ownership in a
 **“you build it, you run it”** 
 environment



  





**Tech environment** 



* Java (Spring / Spring Boot)
* Modern e-commerce platform (Intershop or similar)
* Microservices & REST APIs
* Cloud-based infrastructure (Azure)
* CI/CD, Git, automated testing
* Agile ways of working (Scrum/Kanban)



  





**What they’re looking for** 



* Several years of experience as a Java backend developer
* Experience from e-commerce, retail, logistics, or other transaction-intensive systems
* Strong understanding of backend architecture, integrations and APIs
* Comfortable working in cloud-based environments
* A collaborative mindset and interest in working close to the business domain



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience with Intershop
* Exposure to containers (Docker/Kubernetes)
* Monitoring and observability tools
* DevOps mindset and interest in operational responsibility



  





**What’s on offer** 



* Permanent role in a
 **stable, long-term product organisation**
* Modern tech stack and meaningful, business-critical systems
* Hybrid working model (Stockholm-based)
* Competitive salary and strong benefits package
* A collaborative culture with high technical standards and low ego

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Are you passionate about leveraging data science to drive business impact and take analytics to the next level? Join Mentimeter as our
 **Senior** 
**Data Scientist** 
 , where you will set new standards for data science craft within the Data & Analytics (DNA) department and play a pivotal role in advancing our analytics capabilities to drive impactful, data-informed strategies for our SaaS-based business. Data is not only central, but crucial, to how Mentimeter will reach success.
   

  

 At Mentimeter, the DNA department is on a mission to catalyse our company strategy and drive innovation, growth and impact throughout our company and user journey by using data. We work at the intersection of analytics, data science, and business to deliver actionable insights and solutions that enable better decisions across departments, including Product, Marketing, Sales, and Revenue Operations. Your contributions will directly influence key business outcomes such as customer retention, engagement, and expansion.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll collaborate with and be supported by cross-functional teams of data scientists, data engineers, user researchers, product managers and company leaders who are passionate about Mentimeter’s mission and using data to achieve it.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and deploy machine learning models, such as predictive scoring, clustering, and forecasting, with a strong focus on technical aspects of production deployment.
* Build and ship internal data products that activate models and insights in the right systems and tools to drive impact.
* Be a key part of our Analytics team to align priorities, partner with stakeholders and ensure solutions are relevant and impactful.
* Collaborate closely with our Data Platform Team, Analytics Engineering, and other sister teams to enable the business to proactively act on data and create business impact.
* Elevate the data science craft within the Data & Analytics department by setting new standards, implementing innovative approaches and best practices.
* Provide mentorship and technical guidance to team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth.
* Translate complex data analyses into compelling narratives and visualizations that resonate with diverse audiences.


**We believe you have**
* A minimum of 8 years of relevant work experience.
* Proven expertise in data science methodologies, with strong proficiency in machine learning techniques and programming languages (e.g. Python and SQL).
* Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of sales, marketing, and product analytics.
* Expertise in ML modeling with a focus on production deployment and ML engineering best practices (e.g. versioning, monitoring, testing).
* A builder mindset and interest to build internal products and systems that scale, leveraging automation, generative AI, and data to drive Mentimeter’s growth and efficiency.
* Solid software engineering practices, including git, code reviews, and writing performant, maintainable code.
* Experience collaborating with data engineers on data pipelines, model deployment, and monitoring.
* Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality analyses and actionable insights aligned with business objectives.
* Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts through clear narratives and visualizations.
* A track record of mentoring team members and fostering a culture of best practices and continuous improvement.


**Nice to have**
* Familiarity with modern data tools (e.g. Looker, Hex, Snowflake) and cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud).
* Experience working within a SaaS environment, with a strong understanding of the unique business challenges and opportunities it presents.


**Not Required**
* Swedish is not required (as daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts 50+ different nationalities)


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: System Manager ”Lead to Order”
description:
**Vill du ta en nyckelroll i vår digitala transformation och forma framtidens IT-landskap?**
 Azets är en ledande internationell koncern inom lön, ekonomi och revision med över 9 000 medarbetare, varav cirka 700 i Sverige. Vi är inne i en spännande tillväxtresa och har nyligen förvärvat delar av KPMG Sveriges verksamhet – vilket innebär nya möjligheter och komplexa integrationer.
   

  

 Vi befinner sig just nu på en spännande resa med stark tillväxt och omfattande digital transformation. Nu söker vi en
 **System Manager** 
 som blir en strategisk brygga mellan verksamhet och teknik. Den här rollen ger dig chansen att vara mitt i denna utveckling och driva förändring för framtidens digitala lösningar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som System Manager ansvarar du för att definiera, utveckla och optimera våra end-to-end-processer och systemportfölj inom områdena
 **Lead to Order** 
 med stor fokus på CRM och vår internationella Salesforce-implementering.
   

  

 Du får en central roll i att harmonisera processer och system, leda integrationsstrategier vid förvärv och driva förbättringsinitiativ i nära samarbete med verksamheten, koncernen och externa partners. Det här är en roll med direkt påverkan på affärseffektivitet och IT-strategi – och som dessutom innebär många kontaktytor både i Sverige och internationellt. Du kommer att representera Sverige i globala forum och arbeta nära dina motsvarigheter i andra länder för att säkerställa en gemensam riktning och bästa praxis. I den här rollen rapporterar du till vår IT Director i Sverige.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Utveckla processer och applikationer inom Lead to Order med stort fokus på CRM
* Identifiera och driva digitaliserings- och automationsinitiativ
* Samla in och prioritera verksamhetskrav
* Utveckla och underhålla process- och systemroadmap i linje med koncernstrategi
* Leda integration och harmonisering av system vid nya förvärv
* Säkerställa att applikationer följer regulatoriska och säkerhetskrav
* Budget- och leverantörshantering


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Relevant utbildning
* Gedigen erfarenhet av CRM-system och gärna Salesforce
* Gedigen erfarenhet av applikationsförvaltning och processutveckling
* Kunskap om arkitektur, livscykelhantering och integration
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning och digital transformation
* God förståelse för agilt arbete
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du är en person som trivs med att skapa struktur i komplexa miljöer och har en analytisk förmåga att se samband och driva lösningar. Du bygger starka relationer och kommunicerar tydligt, även i förändringsarbete. Du är trygg i din roll, vågar ta beslut och står stadigt när det är många intressenter och högt tempo. Vi värdesätter också din nyfikenhet och vilja att hitta nya, innovativa sätt att förbättra processer och system.
   

  

**Varför Azets?**
 Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka på riktigt – i en internationell koncern som satsar på digitalisering och tillväxt. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team där vi kombinerar teknik och affär för att skapa framtidens lösningar. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö, kompetensutveckling och en kultur som präglas av samarbete och innovation.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning och är placerad på vårt nyöppnade huvudkontor vid Torsplan i Stockholm. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta gärna Arvid Johansson – arvid.johansson@azets.com eller Carolina Osterman, Talent Acquisition – carolina.osterman@azets.com
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!**
 Ansök

title: ServiceManager (Retail/POS)

 with domain focus in

 Structured and proactive way of working, using defined models and processes where appropriate, resulting in stable operations, early risk mitigation, on-time delivery and cost control.
   

  

 Vendor governance, steering and follow-up daily delivery according to contract, review and management.

 (POS and payment terminals, tablets, displays, scanners, scales, smartphones, printers, wifi, lan, network & communication, sftp, firewalls, integrations, api, data, servers on prem and cloud)

 Technical and complex problem solving understanding
   

  

 Communicates effectively
