title: Sr Revenue Operations Analyst
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 EMEA Revenue Operations team in Sinch is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will require a strong foundation in Salesforce, Excel, Tableau, Power BI as well as other advanced reporting tools, coupled with prior management consulting experience to drive data-driven insights, stakeholder engagement, and strategic decision-making across the EMEA region. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable intelligence to support business growth and efficiency for the region.
 



**In this role you'll make a significant impact by driving the activities in the following areas:** 




**Data Analysis & Reporting** 



* Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets from Salesforce, Excel, Tableau and other platforms.
* Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations in Excel, Tableau and Salesforce.
* Deliver regular and ad-hoc reports to senior management and business stakeholders.



**Business Insights & Strategy** 



* Translate complex data findings into clear business recommendations.
* Identify trends, opportunities, and risks to support regional business objectives.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to optimize processes and improve performance.



**Stakeholder Engagement & Consulting** 



* Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the EMEA region.
* Leverage consulting experience to manage expectations, challenge assumptions, and align on data-driven decisions.
* Gather and translate business requirements into actionable data needs, collaborating closely with data engineering teams to design models and enable effective reporting and BI solutions.



**Data Governance & Best Practices** 



* Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with company standards.
* Promote data-driven decision-making across the organization.
* Drive adoption of dashboards and reporting tools within business teams.







**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:** 



* Maintain and optimize Tableau, Excel, Salesforce reports and dashboards for business needs.
* Design and automate Excel-based models for recurring analysis.
* Build advanced Tableau, Salesforce dashboards to support leadership decision-making.
* Provide performance metrics, KPIs, and business health reporting for EMEA.
* Partner with Sales, Finance, Marketing, Product and Operations teams on cross-regional projects.
* Support strategic initiatives by providing scenario modeling and forecasting.
* Deliver clear documentation and training for stakeholders using analytics tools.







**REQUIREMENTS** 




**Professional Experience** 



* 5-7 years in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics consulting.
* Minimum of 2 years in management consulting or a similar advisory role.
* Strong focus on accuracy, detail, and precision.



**Technical Skills** 



* Advanced Salesforce reporting and data extraction.
* Proficiency in Excel (advanced formulas, pivot tables; macros preferred).
* Expertise in Tableau, Looker, and other visualization tools.
* Nice-to-have: experience with data warehouses (Snowflake) and data build tools (DBT).
* Ability to interpret complex datasets and transform them into actionable insights.



**Stakeholder & Communication Skills** 



* Proven ability to influence, collaborate, and communicate effectively with senior stakeholders.
* Skilled at presenting data in a clear and compelling way.



**Education & Languages** 



* Degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or related field.
* English fluency required; additional EMEA languages are an advantage.







 Our corporate language is English,
 **please submit your application in English** 
 .
 



 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation outside the EU at this time. Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.







**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: New Logo Account Executive - Public Sector
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The New Logo Account Executive is a pivotal role to ensuring ServiceNow’s continued growth. In this role, you will identify new business by strategically navigating a targeted set of prospective accounts to close initial opportunities and convert our Prospects to Customers who will grow with us for years to come. By deeply understanding their unique company challenges and goals, you will pair them with solutions that will help them reach their business objectives and blaze new trails within their organizations. You play a critical part in our “DESCO21” go-to-market strategy, and you will be set up for success within a fast paced, collaborative, and inclusive culture.
   

  

 You are a self-starter and an innovator. You will establish relationships within a defined set of accounts to achieve net new revenue growth targets for your given territory. By leveraging analytics, case studies, past performance, and market intelligence, you will create a territory plan and craft your own target account strategies. You will then apply these strategies and leverage your extended sales team and partner ecosystem to sell the value and long-term ROI of one or more of our industry leading solutions.
   

  

 Post-sale you will lead in orchestrating the transition of these accounts to our established Account Management team as you continue to focus on net new logo accounts.
   

  

**What You Get To Do In This Role**
* Strategic territory planning - Follow a disciplined and analytical approach to planning and maintaining a target new account pipeline. Keep pipeline current and progressing.
* Sales strategies - Develop effective and specific account plans to maximize new revenue growth. Develop and leverage relationships throughout our strong partner networks and in your net new customer accounts to drive strategy through organization.
* Creative marketing and prospecting – Think outside-the-box to cultivate awareness of the ServiceNow vision. Strong planning and execution of targeted campaigns for your territory.
* Customer Acumen - Actively understand each customer’s strategic growth plans, technology footprint and corresponding technology strategy, internal challenges and competitive landscape. Review public information (e.g., new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the prospect.
* Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap.
* Account Transition – After successfully closing your initial sale, you will orchestrate the transition of the account to our Account Management team.
* Net New Revenue – Execute on new business revenue goals for the organization.


**Qualifications**
**To be successful in this role you have:**
* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* Proven track record of new logo sales experience in IT Service Management, HR, Security Operations, Customer Service, IT Operations Management (within software or IT sales organizations) and/or Management Consulting, with a demonstrated ability to generate new business at new accounts.
* Demonstrated experience in territory strategy, planning and sales execution with measurable wins.
* Ability to understand broad, macro-level business IT needs for a prospective client.
* Ability to break down a complex sales process into discrete activities and see steps ahead to deliver customer outcomes.
* Excellent interpersonal skills to inspire and lead a matrix team to establish trust and credibility with prospective customers.
* Demonstrated perseverance, resilience, and savvy to find new creative paths to open doors, increase interaction and participation, and engage prospects.
* The ideal candidate lives our values to “stay hungry and humble” and doesn’t take their success for granted, always curious, ready to learn and evolve.
* Travel up to 50% (depending on geography/region)


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 7+ years of quota carrying, technology solution-based direct sales experience, penetrating net new accounts within a territory.
* Strong sales strategy skills and demonstrated experience prospecting and bringing in new business.
* Experience and success selling a variety of SaaS solutions across all lines of business.
* Demonstrated experience in keeping accurate forecast your territory, monthly/quarterly/annually, utilizing sales tools and analytics to target customers with higher propensity to buy and creating strategies that maximize success.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Track record of consistently achieving or surpassing your sales quota
* Native Swedish


 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Data Engineer till Attendo i Stockholm
description:
**Vill du bidra till Attendos datadrivna resa? Bli Data Engineer, bygg vår dataplattform och driv digitalisering inom omsorgssektorn**
 Som Data Engineer hos Attendo kommer du att vara navet i vårt arbete med att skapa en dataplattform och ett data-drivet arbetssätt för att kunna möta framtidens krav på omsorg. Du arbetar med allt från dataintegration och ETL-processer till att säkerställa att BI-utvecklare får den data som behövs för att skapa värdefulla insikter till verksamheten.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En central roll för Attendos dataplattform, med stort fokus på innovation och skalbarhet.
* Frihet inom och ansvar över att bygga och förbättra datainfrastrukturen, med stöd från ett erfaret arkitektteam.
* Att komma in i en tid där stort fokus är på förändring och där just digitaliseringe & data är bland det högst prioriterade området.
* En möjlighet att utvecklas på bred front och använda din kompetens för att påverka, bidra till och förbättra en verksamhet som fyller en samhällsviktig funktion.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som Data Engineer Hos Attendo Blir Du En Möjliggörarare För Att Skapa Både Robusta Tekniska Lösningar Och Bidra Till Verksamheten i Stort Med Modern Teknik Som Azure, Python Och PowerBI. Konkret Kommer Du Att Arbeta Med Att
   

  

* Bygga, utveckla och sammanfoga Attendos dataplattform i Azuremiljö, inklusive data lake och data warehouse.
* Arbeta med dataintegration och ETL-processer, från flera olika källsystem, för att säkerställa att rätt data är tillgänglig för analys.
* Ha en nära dialog med verksamheten och samarbeta tätt med både BI-utvecklare och behovsägare för att skapa relevanta vyer, förstå affärsbehoven och hjälpa dem att optimera sitt arbete.
* Säkerställa att data hanteras på ett säkert och effektivt sätt, med särskild hänsyn till datasäkerhet och anonymisering.
* Agera teknisk expert inom dataområdet och vara en nyckelspelare i vår digitaliseringsresa.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av ett team med arkitekter, tekniska projektledare och systemutvecklare. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra affärsutvecklingsteam, verksamheten, systemägare och systemförvaltare för att säkerställa att våra IT-lösningar stödjer verksamhetens behov och långsiktiga mål. Du kommer att ha ett nära kompletterande samarbete med BI-utvecklare för att tillsammans driva dataprojekt framåt.
   

  

 Du kommer sitta på Attendos huvudkontor i Danderyd i Stockholm, där du förväntas vilja och vara mycket på plats, men att det också finns möjlighet att jobba remote.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataplattformar och som är bekväm med att ta ägandeskap över, utveckla och optimera tekniska lösningar. Du har god förståelse för datamodellering och hur man strukturerar data på ett sätt som skapar största möjliga värde för verksamheten. Vi ser att du arbetat med och motiveras av att bygga robusta data pipelines samt känner dig hemma i verktyg som Azure och databaser (SQL och NoSQL).
   

  

 För att lyckas ser vi att du har arbetat med dataintegration, ETL-processer och har förståelse för hur data kan omvandlas till insikter. Du trivs i en roll där du samarbetar tätt med både BI-utvecklare och olika delar av verksamheten för att förstå behov och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 Som person är du en driven, självgående och kommunikativ person som trivs med att ta egna initiativ och som kan hantera komplexa frågor kring data och systemintegration. Samtidigt har du förmågan att samarbeta med olika intressenter både inom och utanför din direkta närhet.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Solution Sales Specialist - Nordics - Global Market Insights
description:
**About The Role**
 Are you passionate about creating real value for customers and shaping the future of healthcare insights? We’re looking for a
 **Solution Sales Specialist** 
 to join our team and help leading organizations make smarter decisions through IQVIA’s Global Market Insights solutions.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll combine your consultative approach with deep product expertise to
 **identify opportunities, build strong relationships, and deliver solutions that truly make a difference** 
 . You’ll work with both new and existing large accounts, driving growth while ensuring exceptional customer experience.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Drive growth: Achieve and exceed revenue targets for your assigned solutions.
* Be the expert: Develop deep knowledge of our products and how they create value for clients.
* Collaborate & innovate: Partner with Account Directors to craft winning strategies and proposals.
* Engage at all levels: Build trust with stakeholders and present solutions that solve real challenges.
* Deliver impact: Ensure smooth implementation and high customer satisfaction.
* Spot opportunities: Identify new ways to expand relationships and create added value.
* Shape the future: Share insights and feedback to influence our marketing and product strategies.


**What We’re Looking For**
* A Bachelor’s degree and +/- 5 years of experience in sales or account management.
* Strong understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and market dynamics.
* Proven success in consultative selling and closing new business.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills – you know how to inspire confidence.
* A proactive, resourceful mindset: fast, flexible, and focused on solutions.
* Ability to work independently while thriving in a collaborative team environment.


**Why Join Us?**
* Purpose-driven work: Help healthcare companies make better decisions that improve lives.
* Flexibility & balance: We value work-life harmony and trust you to manage your time.
* Growth opportunities: Continuous learning and career development in a global organization.
* Inclusive culture: Be part of a team that values diversity, collaboration, and innovation.


 IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

title: Senior Developer - TRATON Group R&D
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 In this role, you will work in an environment where collaboration and a deep understanding of user needs guide every decision. By working closely with colleagues, customers, and stakeholders across the TRATON ecosystem, you help create solutions that are technically strong and genuinely meaningful for the people who rely on them. Our values — customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste — shape how we work and grow together.
   

  

 We are now seeking a Senior Developer to design, build, and optimize secure, scalable, high-performing software solutions supporting critical automotive and connected vehicle systems.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, build, and refine modern software services. By engaging with users and stakeholders, you translate real needs into effective technical solutions. You help shape our evolving scope, apply strong architectural thinking, and integrate APIs across vehicle, cloud, and enterprise systems.
   

  

 You mentor others, support continuous improvement, and work iteratively — allowing ideas to evolve, even if it means leaving some behind. Facilitate teamwork through coaching and clear communication, helping teams reach high performance.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You believe that understanding users is essential to building the right solutions, and you thrive when collaborating with others to solve complex problems. You adapt easily to change and work iteratively, allowing ideas to evolve — even if it means leaving some behind for better ones. Clear communication helps you create alignment within the team, and your curiosity and modern development mindset drive continuous learning and improvement.
   

  

 You have 10+ years of experience working across diverse software projects, giving you a solid foundation in modern development practices and architectural thinking. You are proficient in several programming languages, such as Python, Java, Kotlin, and TypeScript, and you’re comfortable building services with frameworks like Ktor. You bring experience with event-driven architectures, API integration, Git, and relevant toolchains such as Polarion. Familiarity with LSP, requirements, and test management.
   

  

 If you also have experience in automotive embedded development or an understanding of vehicle software architecture and connectivity, it is a merit.
   

  

**TRATON Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job Express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-01-12. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Erica Åström Szorath, Head of Requirement Management System, erica.astrom.szorath@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Dynamics 365 Solution Architect
description:
**Vill du ha en nyckelroll i att skapa lösningar på Microsofts mest kraftfulla plattformar? På Innofactor Solutions söker vi en senior Dynamics 365 Solution Architect som vill kombinera affärsförståelse med teknisk spets och driva projekt från första idé till färdig implementering.**
**Om rollen**
 Vi växer i
 **Stockholm** 
 och möter ett ökat kundbehov av avancerade Microsoft-lösningar. Nu söker vi en
 **senior Dynamics 365 Solution Architect** 
 som vill ta helhetsansvar för att designa och implementera lösningar som skapar verklig affärsnytta i regionen.
   

  

 I den här rollen leder du arbetet från första kunddialog till färdig leverans och är länken mellan affärsbehov och teknik. Du arbetar nära sälj, utvecklare och kunder och driver projekt där hela Microsoft-ekosystemet tas tillvara.
   

  

**Huvudansvar:**
* Designa och implementera lösningar i Dynamics 365 Sales och Customer Service, gärna även Field Service eller Business Central.
* Skapa integrationslösningar med API:er, Azure Service Bus och Logic Apps samt modellera processer och anpassa Dynamics efter verksamhetens behov.
* Delta i pre-sale, ta fram lösningsförslag, demo och presentationsmaterial.


 Tjänsten är placerad i
 **Stockholm** 
 . Du kan självklart arbeta både hemifrån och från vårt centrala kontor, men vi ser gärna att du bor i Stockholmsområdet och kan komma in regelbundet.
   

  

**Det vi letar efter**
 ✅ Djup erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 och Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, gärna Power Virtual Agents/AI Builder)
   

  

 ✅ Stark kompetens inom integrationslösningar (API, Azure Service Bus, Logic Apps)
   

  

 Vi tror att du trivs här om du är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att samarbeta nära kund. Vårt team arbetar agilt med stor frihet under ansvar.
   

  

**Saker som kan vara till hjälp, men som du inte behöver kunna från början**
 ➕ Power BI – diskutera arkitektur och skapa enklare dashboards för demo/PoC
   

  

 ➕ Förståelse om hur AI kan användas för kundinsikter och prediktiv analys
   

  

 ➕ Certifiering Power Platform Solution Architect Expert (meriterande om du redan har Dynamics 365 Solution Architect Expert)
   

  

**Vad du får hos oss**
 Du blir en nyckelspelare i strategiska projekt för några av Nordens mest spännande kunder. Här får du frihet att forma lösningar som gör skillnad och en kultur som värdesätter innovation, kompetensdelning och balans i livet.
   

  

**Förmåner**
 Utöver lönen får du flera förmåner som gör vardagen smidigare och roligare:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling
* Flexibelt arbete
* Kollegor som stöttar och delar med sig
* Aktiviteter och nätverk


**Innofactor** 
 är den ledande drivkraften bakom den moderna digitala organisationen i Norden. Vi jobbar med över 1 000 kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor, har det bredaste lösningsutbudet och den starkaste Microsoft-kompetensen i regionen. Vi är cirka 550 specialister i Finland, Sverige, Danmark och Norge.
   

  

 👉 www.innofactor.com
   

  

 #PeopleFirst #AIDriven #BeTheRealYou

title: iOS Developer
description:
**Bokadirekt is currently in the middle of an exciting expansive phase and here, you will be part of an innovative and modern workplace where dedication is strong!** 




  





**About Bokadirekt** 




 Bokadirekt is Sweden's largest app and marketplace for booking mainly beauty and health. With more than 20,000 connected specialists across the country, they make almost all of Sweden's salons and receptions bookable in one place. This includes, for example, hairdressers, masseurs, podiatrists, beauty salons, chiropractors, and much more.
 



  





 At bokadirekt.se, consumers can search, book, and pay for treatments and services with just a few clicks. Every month, 5 million consumers visit bokadirekt.se, and almost 2 million bookings are made via their website and apps.
 



  





 Bokadirekt is growing and employs over 100 people with offices in Stockholm and Luleå.
 



  





**The Role** 




 Bokadirekt is looking for a passionate iOS Developer to join their team and help shape the future of their mobile applications. In this role, you’ll be part of a talented team, and work together to craft elegant, scalable, and high-performing iOS apps. You’ll work not only with existing features but also play a key role in developing new, innovative solutions that make a real impact.
 



  





 We’re looking for a team player who’s curious about new technologies, enjoys solving complex problems, and thrives in a collaborative environment. You’ll be part of a small team with big ambitions, giving you the opportunity to influence decisions, take ownership, and build meaningful features from the ground up. We work in a dynamic environment where things can move quickly, so we value someone who is driven, proactive, and comfortable taking initiative and working in a flexible and changing environment.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Build iOS applications, and ensure high-quality, scalability, and maintainable solutions.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with other product and design teams to ensure the best mobile app for Bokadirekt’s users.
* Stay up to date with iOS development trends, ensuring the team follows best practices and leverages the latest technologies.



  





**Main Technologies:** 



* Swift
* UIKit
* Swift Concurrency
* SwiftUI
* Xcode Cloud



  





**To Succeed In the Role, We Believe You Have Experience In:** 



* 3+ years as a mobile developer, including extensive iOS development experience.
* A proven track record of working in high-performing product teams for over 3 years.
* Working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver user-centered solutions.
* Organizing, growing, maintaining, and modernizing iOS apps effectively.
* An interest in app architecture and scalability, ensuring apps are prepared for growth and change.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 This is an excellent opportunity for someone passionate about mobile development and thrives on collaboration. You’ll have the chance to work on meaningful projects at the heart of Bokadirekt while mentoring others and influencing technical strategies. If you’re ready to take your career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





*Bokadirekt is collaborating with Safemind for this recruitment.*

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
As a Senior Full Stack Developer in our Core Team, your work directly contributes to our mission of automating and simplifying complex procurement processes, ensuring our transaction intensive customers achieve better spend control and can focus on their core business. If you want to work end-to-end, build meaningful features, and contribute to the core of a large-scale SaaS product, this is the place.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




 To continue developing and improving our service, we are now looking for another Java developer to join one of our three development teams. A typical week mixes front-end and back-end development and you’ll:
 


* Build and maintain features in both Java and Angular
* Write automated tests using Java RestAssured
* Dive into key parts of Proceedo such as authentication, user & supplier management, file handling, job queues, approval engines, and reporting
* Collaborate closely with your Core teammates to deliver stable, scalable solutions
* Continuously improve our processes, code base, and technical foundations



 You’ll start with moderately complex features and test automation, supported by the team, before taking on broader areas over time.
 



  





**What we’re looking for** 




 We are looking for someone with solid experience in Java development using Spring, as well as agile development with Scrum and Kanban. You are familiar with modern tools and concepts used in software development such as Git, REST, and OpenAPI.
 



  




* Senior level experience in full stack development
* Strong experience in Java and Angular
* Comfortable working in agile teams
* Experience with OOP and modern front-end development
* Proven AI interest and experience
* Ability to work independently, organize your tasks, and drive development forward
* Familiarity with RestAssured or similar frameworks would be a plus
* Familiarity with automation test writing would be a plus



  





**Who you are** 




 We seek a developer who approaches work with clear focus, curiosity, and ownership. You are focused on quality and impact. You plan your tasks effectively, following through on commitments, and consistently meeting deadlines. As a clear communicator that values teamwork, you proactively speak up when improvements are needed, addressing incomplete requirements or proposing changes to plans. You contributes proactively and are always eager to learn
 



 You are highly inventive, exploring new ideas, following industry trends, and bringing concrete solutions for process or development improvements. Finally, you are highly collaborative, building productive relationships, providing feedback and comfortably asking for help when necessary.
 



  





**Why Proceedo?** 




 You’ll join an ambitious and supportive environment where leadership focuses on solutions. We offer a flexible work environment that respects your personal time and commitments. Our employees get real opportunities to “board the AI train” and apply modern technology in meaningful ways. Most importantly, you’ll be part of a team that supports one another, collaborates openly, and builds smart, scalable products together.
 



  





 If you're ready to work on the systems that power a product used daily by thousands and want to grow in a team that values craft, clarity, and curiosity we’d love to meet you.
 



  





 We will carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. This background check is carried out by an external party and is not carried out without the consent of the applicant.

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, We Cut Out Everything Unnecessary To Give More Back To You As a Consultant. And We Have Done It In The Package Of a Lean And Efficient Organization, Meaning No Overpaid Managers, No Fancy Offices And No Extravagant Conferences. Instead We Give You
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Java Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6–24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is backend Java, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., frontend, integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, data flows) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a high-trust, high-performing team.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We Are Seeking a Java Software Engineer With At Least 5+ Years Of Experience. You Must Have a Proven Ability To Get Things Done. Here’s What We’re Seeking
   

  

* 5+ years of experience building backends with Java
* A cloud native background using Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS / GCP / Azure and Terraform - or such.
* Experience from additional languages such as TypeScript, JavaScript, Scala, Kotlin etc. is also appreciated.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, temporary or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Head of Communications BCSS
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 Are you a visionary communications leader with a passion for impactful storytelling, executive engagement, and driving business transformation across global markets? Ericsson is seeking a dynamic Head of Communications to lead and elevate our communications strategy for both our Business Area Cloud Software and Services (BCSS) and Global Service Centres (GSCs) across China, India, Mexico and Romania.
   

  

 As Head of Communications, you will lead a high-performing team responsible for executive communications, media relations, strategic narrative development, external positioning, and internal communications.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Act as a trusted senior communications advisor to BCSS Leadership Team, including the Head of BCSS, and source of thought leadership, crafting compelling narratives and delivering world-class executive communications.
* Define and deploy BCSS strategic narrative to position us as an industry leader in cutting edge Software and Services, translate technical and commercial priorities into clear, audience-specific messages for internal and external audiences.
* Drive external communication, expanding Ericsson’s presence in both traditional and non-traditional media, and working in close collaboration with Group Communication, supporting policy, regulatory, and government advocacy efforts.
* Oversee internal communications programs, strategy communication, all-employee meetings, leadership messaging, and change communication to enable business and culture transformation and employee engagement internally.
* Lead a high-performing, cross-disciplinary team responsible for executive visibility, strategic narrative development, external and employee communications.
* Mentor and grow communications talent, manage budgets and agency relationships, and ensure agile delivery and governance across regions and corporate stakeholders.
* You will work on a strategic level, but you are equally comfortable to work hands on with the organization.


**You will bring**
* 12+ years of progressive communications experience, including at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
* Proven expertise in enterprise B2B, telecoms, or technology sector communications.
* Strong track record in executive communications, reputation management, global media/analyst relations.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams and working closely with C-suite stakeholders in a fast-paced matrix organization.
* Exceptional writing, storytelling, and messaging skills, with the ability to translate complex topics into clear business narratives.
* Executive presence and strong collaboration skills.
* Capabilities to think new, pushing boundaries, utilizing the advantages of digitalization and using innovative communication tools.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with tight deadlines
* Bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, business, or a related field; advanced degrees or strategic communications certifications are a plus


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond to applications sent via e-mail. We target 60% work-from-the office.
   

  

 Last day to apply: 19th January 2026
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Hiring Manager Cecilia Atterwall, Head of Group Marketing and BCSS M&C at cecilia.atterwall@ericsson.com or Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 779232

title: Software Engineer .NET
description:
Are you passionate about APIs, thrive on bringing structure and efficiency to team workflows, and ready to shape the future of API management? Join us to work with cutting-edge technology, drive innovation, and take your skills to the next level!
   

  

 Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate. Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be an integral part of the API Team, enabling customers to access Tele2 services via APIs from various frontend channels. Our mission is to deliver an exceptional experience for both consumer and business customers by providing the necessary data they need. We offer services that allow data to be consumed by other applications and systems, managing these services from start to finish. Beyond just technical delivery, you'll also be instrumental in helping us refine our processes, ensure our work is well-organized, and contribute to the overall efficiency of the team. Our team operates within the Microsoft stack, fostering a culture where teamwork and inclusion are paramount.
   

  

 Your tasks and responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):
   

  

* Developing and maintaining APIs built in .NET
* Managing and maintaining Azure API Management
* Overseeing the internal developer portal Backstage
* Communicating and supporting numerous stakeholders as a central component
* Providing specialist support across the organization for API management
* Sharing your expertise with the team and learning new skills from others
* Adhering to patterns that promote robust services and continuously improving the team’s capabilities
* Actively contributing to and refining team processes, workflows, and best practices to enhance clarity and efficiency.
* Helping to organize and prioritize team initiatives, ensuring a structured approach to problem-solving and delivery.


**What we look for:**
 We are a collaborative team that works closely with other backend and frontend teams to coordinate our efforts. Maintaining strong relationships with architects and being able to navigate unclear information to create our own requirements is crucial. Beyond technical prowess, you possess a keen eye for detail and a drive to bring structure and clarity to complex problems and workflows. You are comfortable taking initiative in organizing team activities and ensuring that projects progress in a well-planned manner.
   

  

 To be successful in this role and a good fit for our team, you should have a strong ambition to develop new functionalities while managing and maintaining existing solutions.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe that you have:**
* At least some years of experience in API development using .NET
* Experience with Azure or other cloud platforms
* Knowledge of Docker, deploy pipelines, and Kubernetes terminology
* Some experience with JavaScript/React for working with Backstage
* Basic knowledge of security concepts (encryption with keys, SSL/TLS, HTTPS)
* A proactive, curious and organization-minded approach to problem-solving and team collaboration
* Demonstrated ability to contribute to process improvement, workflow optimization, or team organization within a software development context.

title: Senior Solution Architect – Business Central
description:
Position Description
   

  

 CGI Sverige har ett starkt växande globalt Center of Excellence för Microsoft Business Central.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och skapa affärsnytta med Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central? Har du en strategisk blick för IT-lösningar och en passion för att hjälpa företag att utvecklas? Är du intresserad av utmanande uppdrag och frågeställningar med en mix av nordiska och internationella kunder?
   

  

 Då är det dig vi söker till CGI!
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 Som Solution Architect inom Business Central på CGI får du en nyckelroll i att designa och implementera affärskritiska systemlösningar för våra kunder. Du arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov, identifiera möjligheter till digitalisering och utforma skalbara lösningar som skapar ett verkligt affärsvärde.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Delta i implementationsprojekt – från behovsanalys och design till leverans och uppföljning.
* Designa lösningsarkitektur för nya implementationer och uppgraderingar av Business Central – för att skapa effektiva verksamhetsflöden och kundnytta.
* Delta i presale och affärsutveckling – du är en viktig rådgivare i säljprocessen och hjälper kunder att förstå värdet av våra lösningar.
* Hålla workshops och utbildningar för kunder och interna team.
* Vara en mentor och kunskapsdelare – du coachar och vägleder kollegor och kunder.
* Tillsammans med andra arkitekter och utvecklare arbeta internt för en effektiv och innovativ utveckling av CGIs processer och arbetssätt gällande Business Central.
* Omvärldsbevakning för att ligga i framkant kring Business Central, Microsofts Ecosystem samt innovativa lösningar och partners.
* Representera CGI på branschevent och seminarier samt bidra till vår marknadsföring och thought leadership.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
* Minst 6-8 års erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central/NAV.
* Relevant kunskap kring Azure och molntjänster, inklusive drift och förvaltning av molnbaserade miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att skriva funktionella specifikationer, akitekturbeskrivningar och teknisk dokumentation.
* Förmåga att arbeta kundnära och utveckla långsiktiga relationer.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga, vana att hålla workshops och presentationer.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* En strukturerad och lösningsorienterad inställning, med fokus på att leverera resultat enligt överenskomna mål.
* Relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.


 Det är även meriterande om du har certifieringar inom Business Central, Power Platform eller Azure.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är engagerad, lösningsorienterad, analytisk och affärsorienterad. Du är van vid att ta ansvar, har ett proaktivt arbetssätt och trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Resor ingår i rollen. Det finns möjligheter till distansarbete, men det styrs utifrån kundönskemål och överenskommelse med konsultchef. Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Ansökningarna kommer hanteras löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Skicka gärna dina funderingar till Jan Westlund, Director Consulting Expert - Dynamics Business Central, på: jan.westlund@cgi.com.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**
 På CGI blir du en del av ett av världens största IT- och affärskonsultföretag med en stark lokal närvaro. Vi erbjuder en stabil arbetsmiljö med långsiktiga karriärmöjligheter, kompetensutveckling och en kultur präglad av samarbete och innovation. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande kundprojekt och vara med och påverka både vår och våra kunders utveckling.
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner och flexibelt arbetssätt.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med några av marknadens mest spännande företag.
* En stark gemenskap där vi värdesätter kunskapsdelning och personlig utveckling.


**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
   

  

 Senior Solution Architect – Business Central
   

  

**Job Description**
 CGI Sverige har ett starkt växande globalt Center of Excellence för Microsoft Business Central.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och skapa affärsnytta med Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central? Har du en strategisk blick för IT-lösningar och en passion för att hjälpa företag att utvecklas? Är du intresserad av utmanande uppdrag och frågeställningar med en mix av nordiska och internationella kunder?
   

  

 Då är det dig vi söker till CGI!

Du arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå deras behov, identifiera möjligheter till digitalisering och utforma skalbara lösningar som skapar ett verkligt affärsvärde.

* Delta i implementationsprojekt – från behovsanalys och design till leverans och uppföljning.
* Designa lösningsarkitektur för nya implementationer och uppgraderingar av Business Central – för att skapa effektiva verksamhetsflöden och kundnytta.
* Delta i presale och affärsutveckling – du är en viktig rådgivare i säljprocessen och hjälper kunder att förstå värdet av våra lösningar.
* Hålla workshops och utbildningar för kunder och interna team.
* Vara en mentor och kunskapsdelare – du coachar och vägleder kollegor och kunder.
* Tillsammans med andra arkitekter och utvecklare arbeta internt för en effektiv och innovativ utveckling av CGIs processer och arbetssätt gällande Business Central.
* Omvärldsbevakning för att ligga i framkant kring Business Central, Microsofts Ecosystem samt innovativa lösningar och partners.
* Representera CGI på branschevent och seminarier samt bidra till vår marknadsföring och thought leadership.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
* Minst 6-8 års erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central/NAV.
* Relevant kunskap kring Azure och molntjänster, inklusive drift och förvaltning av molnbaserade miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att skriva funktionella specifikationer, akitekturbeskrivningar och teknisk dokumentation.
* Förmåga att arbeta kundnära och utveckla långsiktiga relationer.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga, vana att hålla workshops och presentationer.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* En strukturerad och lösningsorienterad inställning, med fokus på att leverera resultat enligt överenskomna mål.
* Relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.


 Det är även meriterande om du har certifieringar inom Business Central, Power Platform eller Azure.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är engagerad, lösningsorienterad, analytisk och affärsorienterad. Du är van vid att ta ansvar, har ett proaktivt arbetssätt och trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Resor ingår i rollen. Det finns möjligheter till distansarbete, men det styrs utifrån kundönskemål och överenskommelse med konsultchef. Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Ansökningarna kommer hanteras löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan i dag! Skicka gärna dina funderingar till Jan Westlund, Director Consulting Expert - Dynamics Business Central, på: jan.westlund@cgi.com.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**
 På CGI blir du en del av ett av världens största IT- och affärskonsultföretag med en stark lokal närvaro. Vi erbjuder en stabil arbetsmiljö med långsiktiga karriärmöjligheter, kompetensutveckling och en kultur präglad av samarbete och innovation. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande kundprojekt och vara med och påverka både vår och våra kunders utveckling.
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner och flexibelt arbetssätt.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med några av marknadens mest spännande företag.
* En stark gemenskap där vi värdesätter kunskapsdelning och personlig utveckling.


**Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.**
 La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…
   

  

 Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.
   

  

 Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.
   

  

 Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.
   

  

 Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

title: SAP Utilities Architect
description:
Are you ready for the next step in your SAP career? Do you want to work in a flexible environment with exciting assignments. We are now looking for a SAP Retail Architect who wants to help shape the solutions of the future. Welcome to CGI!
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 As a SAP Utilities consultant, you will play a key role in our energy and utilities practice and:
   

  

* Design, implement, and support SAP solutions within the Utilities industry (Electricity, Gas, Water, or Waste Management).
* Work closely with business stakeholders to translate functional requirements into system configurations and deliver end-to-end SAP IS-U (Industry Solution for Utilities) processes that optimize business performance.
* Participating in pre-studies, requirements analysis, and solution design together with clients and project teams.
* Ensuring integration between SAP Utilities modules and other systems.
* Providing advisory services and acting as an expert in SAP utilities for both projects and application management.


 Our clients are at different stages of their S/4HANA journey – from planning to full implementation – and you will play a central role in guiding them through this transformation.
   

  

 Read more about our offer: Energi & Utilities | CGI Sverige
   

  

 (Energi & Utilities – CGI Sverige).
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
* Strong understanding of end-to-end Utilities business processes (meter-to-cash, customer management, billing, and payments).
* Proficiency in at least two of the following SAP IS-U modules: DM, BI, FI-CA, CS, EDM.
* Experience with integration between IS-U and other SAP components (CRM, BW, S/4HANA, FIORI).
* Support data migration, testing (unit, integration, UAT), and user training.
* Proven experience in architecture and design within SAP environments, preferably in S/4HANA.
* Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
* Strong communication skills and experience working in complex project environments.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 You are great at building strong relationships and quickly understanding new situations. You enjoy working with others, are attentive and supportive, and like to challenge yourself. With both an analytical mindset and creative problem-solving skills, you handle complex tasks with precision and confidence.
   

  

**Want to Learn More?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Applications will be reviewed continuously, and the position may be filled before the final application deadline. For further questions, please feel free to send your inquiries to Santosh Nimbhorkar, santosh.nimbhorkar@cgi.com
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Business Engineering Manager (mjukvaruutveckling)
description:
Karlstad


Business Engineering Manager (mjukvaruutveckling)



Världsledande inom ingenjörstjänster – vi samlar ett globalt team av ingenjörer, forskare och arkitekter för att hjälpa världens mest innovativa företag att frigöra sin fulla potential. Från självkörande bilar till livräddande robotar – våra experter inom digital och mjukvaruteknik tänker utanför ramarna och levererar unika FoU- och ingenjörstjänster inom alla branscher. Bli en del av oss för en karriär full av möjligheter. Där du kan göra skillnad. Där ingen dag är den andra lik.

**Din roll**


Som Business Engineering Manager ansvarar du för att rekrytera & bygga ett team av mjukvaruingenjörer i Karlstad, samt att vara delaktig i säljprocessen. För att rekrytera rätt talanger så kommer du att samarbeta med vårt Talent Acquisition-team och för sälj kommer du att samarbeta med våra kundansvariga. Du brinner för att utveckla ditt team och bygga en bra kultur på kontoret.

*I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:*

* Rekrytera nya konsulter
* Du utvecklar människorna för att säkerställa att de växer i deras roll som konsult
* Bygga kundrelationer och säkerställa förlängningar av pågående uppdrag samt merförsäljning inom ditt område
* Bidra till tekniska lösningar/försäljningsaktiviteter av nya projekt
* Ta del av teknisk leverans/uppdrag mot våra uppdragsgivare.
* Stödja Engineering Unit Manager med personalhantering, affärstillväxt, etc.

**Din profil**

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet från ledande roller inom relevant bransch som telekom, transport, energi, försvar eller liknande
* Högskole/universitetsexamen inom datavetenskap, elektronik, datakommunikation eller närliggande område
* Tidigare erfarenhet som Scrum Master / Projektledare / Teamledare / Teknisk ledare
* Erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
* Flytande i svenska är ett krav.

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**

* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling genom Capgemini Engineering Academy
* Bra balans mellan arbete och fritid med generös semesterplan
* Förmånligt anställningspaket med pensionsplan, försäkringar och friskvårdsbidrag
* Möjlighet att delta i globala nätverk och kunskapsutbyte

**Ansökan**


Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller kan genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.


#LI-AN5


1. The Software Engineering Leader oversees and guides teams to deliver high quality software solutions aligned with organizational goals and industry best practices.2. Is a professional in technology, proficient in strategic planning, decision making, and mentoring, with an extensive background in software development and leadership.3. Is typically responsible for setting the strategic direction of software development efforts, managing project portfolios, and ensuring effective execution of software engineering initiatives to meet organizational objectives.4. Builds skills and expertise in leadership, staying abreast of industry trends, and cultivating a collaborative and high performance culture within the software engineering team.5. Collaborates and acts as a team player with cross functional teams, executives, and stakeholders, fostering a positive and productive environment for successful software development initiatives.**Om Capgemini**  

Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.

  

Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Field Sales Engineer (Instrumentation)
description:
Are you a professional seeking a new challenge in a dynamic and fast developing business? By joining anywhere in **the North of Sweden** as **Field Sales Engineer (Instrumentation),** you will become part of the Nordics Global Sales team, with immediate responsibilities for **North Sweden** .


This role is essential for primarily developing, as well as maintaining and improving direct customer contacts and relationships in line with the defined "Go to Market" philosophy for end users primarily in the Chemical, Pulp & Paper and Metals & Mining industries. By engaging with our customers, you will work towards delivering the company's ambitious growth targets. The focus is on selling and promoting products, services, concepts, and solutions offered by the **Measurement Solutions Business Unit.**

**Let's Go, together!** We offer a dynamic environment where individual contributions and inventions are valued and provide opportunities for training and self-development.


Please note we follow a process of continuous selection and will close the vacancy as soon as we find the right candidate, so do not delay submitting the application.  



**In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:**

* Promoting products and services across the assigned sales area
* Visiting key accounts and prospects to assess potential and strengthen relationships
* Understanding customer drivers and staying current with their business needs
* Preparing annual booking budgets by product, value and period
* Submitting call plans, analyses and reports with timely accuracy
* Reporting sales plans and project potential through CRM updates
* Liaising with internal teams to prioritize quotations and maintain service levels
* Participating in relevant industry events

**Who You Are:**

You actively listen and check for understanding, and you adjust communication content and style to meet the needs of diverse stakeholders.


Your proactive approach to identifying and pursuing new business opportunities sets you apart. You diligently seek out and engage potential clients with enthusiasm and determination, always aiming to expand the customer base and drive sales growth.


You anticipate customer needs and provide services that are beyond customer expectations. You use customer insights to drive and guide the development of new offerings.


You create teamwork, allowing others across the organization to achieve shared objectives, fostering collaboration and ensuring that everyone works together towards common goals.  



**For This Role, You Will Need:**

* Technical degree, or equivalent experience
* Proven **sales / business development** experience in a **commercial role**
* Exposure to **industrial automation environment** (e.g. chemical, Pulp & Paper, and Metals & Mining industries), with a good **technical understanding (ideally measuring instrumentation)**
* CRM & MS Office tools
* Proficiency in **English and Swedish language**
* **Willingness to travel** in the country and regionally
* **Driver’s license**

**Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:**

* Previous experience with flow measurement solutions
* Matrix organization experience
* Interest in energy efficiency and sustainability

**Our Culture & Commitment to You**

At Emerson, we prioritize a workplace where every employee is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We foster an environment that encourages innovation, collaboration, and diverse perspectives—because we know that great ideas come from great teams.


Our commitment to ongoing career development and growing an inclusive culture ensures you have the support to thrive. Whether through mentorship, training, or leadership opportunities, we invest in your success so you can make a lasting impact. We believe diverse teams, working together are key to driving growth and delivering business results.  



**What We Offer**

* A varied and creative role in the exciting and fast-growing field of automation
* Excellent opportunities for personal growth and long-term career development within EMERSON, a global leader
* A supportive and welcoming atmosphere within our dynamic Nordic team
* An international environment where motivated people truly make an impact
* Flexible working hours and the option to partially work from home
* A neutral company car available for both business and private use
* An attractive sales incentive plan (SIP) / bonus program
* Collective Agreement (Teknikavtalet)
* Pension plan
* Accident and life insurance
* Other (computer glasses, wellness allowance, subsidized lunch, optional insurances and many more)

  
**WHY EMERSON**

**Our Commitment to Our People**

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.


We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.


At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.


**Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation**

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .  



**ABOUT EMERSON**

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.


With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.


We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go!


**No calls or agencies please.**
company_description: Emerson combines industry knowledge, manufacturing expertise, and technological innovation to offer a broad range of products and services.

title: Principal PLC/Automation Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

We are looking for a Principal PLC/Automation Engineer who will lead the launch of a new project from the ground up. In this role, you will design and implement the automation architecture, develop PLC-based control systems, and integrate energy-efficient solutions.


You will collaborate closely with cross-functional specialists, define technical requirements, select appropriate hardware and control strategies, and ensure reliable, sustainable system performance.

**PROJECT**


This is a new greenfield project, aimed at developing advanced water treatment technologies with optimized energy consumption. The solution will integrate solar and alternative energy sources to ensure sustainable and stable operation.

 **Job Description**  

* Design and program PLC-based automation systems
* Develop HMI/SCADA interfaces and monitoring tools
* Integrate sensors, pumps, VFDs, and instrumentation for water-cleaning processes
* Implement energy-optimized control strategies adapted to renewable power sources
* Create system documentation (FDS, control narratives, test plans, electrical diagrams)
* Lead FAT, on-site commissioning, troubleshooting, and optimization
* Ensure compliance with safety, quality, and electrical standards
* Coordinate with process, mechanical, and electrical teams throughout the project

  

**Qualifications**  

* 10+ years in industrial automation/PLC engineering
* Proven background in process automation (preferably water/wastewater)
* Hands-on experience with VFDs, industrial networks (Profinet, Modbus), and instrumentation
* Ability to design control architecture and lead full lifecycle from concept to commissioning
* Strong understanding of electrical principles, panel design, and safety standards
* Excellent problem-solving and documentation skills
* English level: Upper-Intermediate or higher

title: Java Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Java Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6–24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is backend Java, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., frontend, integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, data flows) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a high-trust, high-performing team.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Java Software Engineer with at least 5+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience building backends with Java
* A cloud native background using Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS / GCP / Azure and Terraform - or such.
* Experience from additional languages such as TypeScript, JavaScript, Scala, Kotlin etc. is also appreciated.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, temporary or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

 Stockholm (Hybrid – 3 days/week in office)
